This meal consists of Nasi Goreng with omelette, three sticks satė, salad and krupuk (shrimp crackers), which is not overpriced at all. Fish filet with tartar sauce, French fries, and a fresh salad with a big bottle of beer costs IDR 132000 which is around US$ 9.5. The Value added taxes (VAT) in our restaurant is 10%.

In our restaurant we use only the best and the freshest ingredients. 

Thank you so much for your stay at Hotel Deli River!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The Hotel Deli River is as lovely and peaceful an oasis as one could ask for, masterfully created amidst the bustle of suburban Medan. With an excellent restaurant, an established touring company, an extensive and beautiful tropical garden, a lovely swimming pool, and a crew of well trained staff, the family run Hotel Deli River offers everything you need with a personal touch. The owner, Diana, along with her tour manager Juli, not only provided much assistance to us in planning our itinerary, but Diana even took the time to call us after we had left the hotel, when we were en route with her driver, to ensure that all was going well and answer any other questions we might have.

If you are not looking for a hotel in the heart of the Medan, the Hotel Deli River is highly recommended.
title: A Taste of Indonesian Paradise

text:
Overall this is a very clean and well run hotel with beautifully maintained gardens but it's location is isolated. The street outside is very busy and dirty with not much on it except for a convenience store or two. It's not walking distance or an easy commute to the more central areas of Medan. It is also about an hour to or from the airport (longer in rush hour). Please find a detailed summary below
Positives: quiet, good food in restaurant, air conditioning, cable TV, wifi in main areas and room, beautiful gardens, play area for kids
Negatives: isolated from city, not walkable to other restaurants/main stores
I would overall recommend stay here if you're looking for a quiet, isolated spot and don't wish to be in the main region of Medan.
title: Great hotel but poor location!

text:
stayed 2 night 3 days.
Room is very clean with nice furniture made by real wood. bathroom is also very clean and have a bathtub.lots of hotels use the fake wood bed. But here, they probably made one by one by hand. thats totally amazing. 
In the room, out of the room both very nice. 

Amazing is the breakfast.  hotel stuff set the table at the terrace which is garden view. 
Fresh Indonesian fruits and bread and more. 

Hotel stuff are all friendly and very kind. they help me a lot and also recommended the very delicious food ! 

Medan is a busy city. i recommend this hotel not only travelers but also someone who works at indonesia / singapore / malaysia.  
I stayed this hotel and totally no-stress now :)

Thank you so much !!
title: lovely hotel amazing breakfast

text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Deli River before and after our 5 day trip to Bukit Lawang and Lake Toba..
The grounds and location of the hotel and restaurant are very pleasant and, most importantly, way from the traffic.  The gardens were very peaceful and lush -  complete with two amiable quacking ducks!.  
Our cottage room was very modern,  clean, cool and spacious.  

This owner operated hotel is a credit to Diana and Dirk.  Diana took care of all of our arrangements for the tour and did so very gracefully and cheerfully as we had left it all to the last minute.
The staff  were bright and  most attentive and food in the restaurant tasty.  It was also a nice change to sample some Dutch treats like the croquettes.

We would definitely recommend this hotel for a guaranteed comfortable and enjoyable stay.
title: A lovely oasis

text:
We stayed two nights at Hotel Deli River, at the beginning and end of a 15 day trip through North and West Sumatra that we arranged through Tri Jaya Tour and Travel (operated by the owners of the hotel, Diana and Dirk) in November 2014.  As another reviewer has already described it, the hotel is in an oasis like garden compound situated in the middle of bustling Medan.  The room we stayed in was lovely and came fully equiped with electric kettle and other amenities.  The staff were extremely polite and hospitable, not to mention very efficient and attentive.  The hotel has a pleasantly laid out restaurant which offers very good food at reasonable prices.  The hotel and restaurant were both spotlessly clean.

We would also highly recommend Tri Jaya Tour and Travel.  They dealt with us in a highly professional and responsive manner, from our initial email inquiries to our departure from Medan at the end of our trip.  The travel itinerary which they arranged for us was well thought out.  We saw a wide variety of things in North and West Sumatra (including Medan, Bukit Lawang, Berestagi, Lake Toba and Samosir Island, Bukkittinggi, Lake Maninjau, Harau and Padang).  The schedule allowed us ample time to breathe and see things along the way.  We were never rushed and had the flexibility to do our own thing when desired throughout the trip.  The hotels were excellent, including the very hospitable arrangements at Iqbal Homestay in the beautiful Harau area.  Diana took the time upon our arrival to offer useful advice on practicalities and things we could do with our free time, and we enjoyed our conversations with Dirk on his historical researches into Medan's history upon our return to Medan.  Last, but not least, our driver cum guide, Erwin, was first class.

Thank you to all!
title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Tour

text:
We stayed at Hotel Deli River for 3 nights in total, 1 night before and 2 nights after our tour of North Sumatra (organised by Tri Jaya, the excellent tour operator run by the hotel’s owners).  

Hotel Deli River is an oasis in Medan, set in beautiful gardens around a large duck pond with a lovely swimming pool at the back of the property overlooking the river.  Our room was very large, spotlessly clean with extremely comfortable beds, a rare treat in Asia.  

The owners, Dirk and Diana were warm and welcoming and ensured we were taken care of in every respect.  The staff were friendly and efficient and the food was fresh and delicious. Inclusive breakfast was a feast we looked forward to every morning and varied every day; we were treated to a wide range of delicacies every day which included toast, jam, honey, boiled eggs, vegetable fritters, pineapple muffins, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, sticky rice, doughnuts etc as well as great coffee and fresh fruit juice.  It more than set us up for the whole day!

Wifi was fast and reliable in all areas of the hotel.

We would highly recommend Hotel Deli River to anyone visiting Medan or travelling through North Sumatra, it’s clear to see why this is the number 1 hotel in Medan.  We would also highly recommend Tri Jaya tours (tours@trijaya-travel.com) which is the tour company also run by Dirk and Diana, during which we visited Lake Toba, Samosir Island, Berestagi volcanoes and hand fed the majestic orang-utans in Bukit Lawang.  It was a trip we’ll never forget.

Thank you Dirk and Diana for being wonderful hosts and great ambassadors for Sumatra.  We hope to  be back one day! :-)
title: Fabulous hotel and tour of Sumatra - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

text:
We stayed here for one night. The bed's are great, breakfast was continental and was fine.
Great hygiene and the staff was super friendly!
A big plus is that it doesn't lay directly to the busy main road in Medan, so it's pretty quiet at night.
title: Excellent hotel with a great and friendly staff

text:
This hotel lies down a narrow lane off a busy road choked with chaotic traffic.
It is laid out a bit like a compound, two 3story buildings face a pond with water lilies, opposite is the main building with 2 levels of outside seating to have your meals and in the back is a swimming pool.
With dinner comes a bottle of moscito repellent so one can enjoy the food better.
The owner Diana is very welcoming and open to suggestions regarding the trip itinerary ( since I came one day late, the hotels had to be rescheduled).
If you must stay in Medan, this is the place to be.
title: Location

text:
We booked a trip over N-Sumatra via Trijaya, Sumatra Travel Specialist. Deli River Hotel was our start and ending point. We appreciated the friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were perfectly clean and well equipped. Good wifi access, excellent food. Perfectly maintained swimming pool in nice tropical green surroundings. Personal attention from staff and owners was a plus.

We fully agree with the positive comments of other travellers and highly recommend the hotel as well as Trijaya for a discovery of wonderfull Norht Sumatra
title: Excellent starting point for a visit to North Sumatra

text:
We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful and well organized hotel. The hotel is managed by very friendly and helpful people and owned by leuke Dutch/ Indonesian people. It was a perfect mix between being relatively close to the city of Medan and staying in the oasis of a quiet, calm and safe environment. 

Our teenaged children enjoyed the pool and restaurant (free Wifi :)) with next to Indonesian food also pannenkoeken en poffertjes on the menu. The hotel/ restaurant has a wonderful view and decor. 

We arranged our tours and trips through/ from this hotel for a part of Sumatra, they have the best connections to give you a smooth and yet authentic sight. We specially liked our (Hotel Deli connected) senior driver and guide Mr. Erwin since he was calm, always on time and he had a lot of nice stories on the area. He was helpful and friendly, all English spoken. We came to this hotel in our first 3 days which was perfect for acclimatizing from our Dutch to the Indonesian world and temperature. After doing a roundtrip to the jungle and lake Toba (well organized by Deli) we wanted to come back for a 'pause' in a familiar place. We felt very welcome and at home.

Prices maybe little above Indonesian average but still for European standards very reasonable. Price/ quality is very good, specially with children (pool, large terrain etc.) and for people who want to see crowded and historical Medan but still enjoy the quietness of a spatial and clean hotel.

I would describe Deli River as the best kept secret of the Medan area.
title: Medan area best kept secret

text: After having arrive in Medan, we were so happy to stay a bit offside Medan city centre. The hotel is very nice and clean. We had a warm welcome there and felt home every minute we stayed there. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Ellie! We had a very nice and clean room. The food was good and fresh. If I had to stay in Medan again, I would definitely go there again.
title: Paradies in Medan

text:
We had 3 nights at the Deli river hotel in Medan Indonesia. Very nice and comforteble rooms, delicius food and perfect pool. All is very clean and the owners and their staff are so nice and helpfull. They arranged pick up at the airport and we had a trip to the Jungle in the mountains. All was just perfect. The locations is a little out of the center of Medan, but we loved it. The prictures on their webpage are good but it is more nice when you get there.
Thanks for a perfect stay in Medan, Indonesia.
title: Nice family hotel in Medan

text: We used this charming hotel in Medan as a base for a five-day round trip to Lake Toba and Berastagi. We stayed in the honeymoon suite, with its own excellent bathroom and a lovely high bed (although we found the pillows a bit small and hard). Diana (of Trijaya Tours) organised our travel in a comfortable car, with a reliable, considerate and friendly driver, for our trip to Samosir Island. We stayed on the island for 3 nights in the Toledo Inn (a very large hotel, beautiful buildings and gardens, a wonderful view of the lake, although rather impersonal in our experience - but choices on Samosir seem to be limited). Our driver showed us many fascinating aspects of Batak life in that area, and we spent the last night at  the Grand Mutiara hotel in Berastagi . This was another large hotel, more luxurious than the Toledo Inn & catering for large tour groups. The dining room was excellent & there was a fantastic view of the volcano Mt Sinabung smoking away, from the hotel foyer.
title: Outstanding accommodation and travel agent

text:
We took the honey moon suite which was only a year old and wasn't that much more. Very clean and comfortable.
Loved the hotel and the people who work there. All so helpful and lovely. 
We organised a tour through Trijaya Travel and they work out of the Hotel Deli River. Juli organised our trip to Bukit Lawang to see the Orangutans plus to Tangkahan to see the elephants. Our driver/tour guide was Rudi and he was above and beyond fantastic! If you can ask for him, do! He went out of his way to make sure we had the ultimate trip. I can't say enough great things about Rudi and our tour. 
Medan is so Hectic and the Hotel Deli River is like a little sanctuary away from the craziness. 
Fantastic experience!
title: Great Place and Friendly Staff

text:
We wanted to combine a Lake Toba/Bukit Lawang hoilday with a short stopover in Medan and Hotel Deli River fitted the bill perfectly. The owners could not have been more hospitable and helpful. They arranged the full itinerary for us together with an excellent tour guide Deny who went out of his way to make the whole experience thoroughly enjoyable.
The Hotel itself is a perfect green oasis and away from the hustle and bustle of Medan. Rooms are  spacious, comfortable and have lovely balconies overlooking the tropical gardens.
This is the second time we have visited the Medan/Lake Toba region with the first some 30 years ago. Given our unforgettable experience and privilege of seeing the Orang-utans at Bukit Lawang our next visit will be much sooner.
title: A great place to start and finish a tour

text:
I came to Sumatra on the spur of the moment for 6 days. I stayed here for 2 days and then Trijaya (the tour company operated by the owners of the hotel) organised me a trip to the highlands although these were very busy with the holidays. The I came back to Medan for the last day.

It is a small hotel (12 cabins) set in a lovely garden. On the other side of the garden is the restaurant. All is absolutely spotless and the staff are very friendly. Very good for the start or finish of a holiday or just from some days of get-away-from-it-all.
title: As good as the other reviewers say

text:
I spent 3 weeks in Medan and also in the Deli River Hotel. I can warmly recommend this Deli River Hotel, extra after my personal experiences with others Medan hotels. Hotel offers very clean, rarely quiet place in the middle of small private „botanic garden“, air-conditioned rooms with TV, C+W water, beautiful clean swimming pool, tasty cusine (I can honestly recommend to try a chicken sote) and very experienced owners in indonesian sights and history, conductive to their guests with advice. Every time in Deli River Hotel I could be sure that everithing will be perfect. This is in Indonesia still very uncommon.
...and don´t forgot order to breakfast a noodle menu! :-)
title: 4 stars hotel 4 me

text:
Great location away from the noise and mayhem of Medan.
Very good clean rooms with air con. Very efficient travel agency connect to the hotel.
Food was a little dissapointing with such good facilities one would hope for better value.
Would deffinatley stay again. Swimming pool marvelous.
title: Away from the madness of Medan

text: From this hotel we traveled to some historic places on Sumatra. We spend 3 nights here. The rooms are spacious, quiet and clean. The garden is beautiful and well kept. The swimming pool is very nice and relaxing after a hot day. It has a great view on the Deli river and makes you almost forget you are near the centre of this large city. The restaurant serves good food. Staff is helpful and nice. The owner is a historian and was very helpful in planning our trip. We had a quick response to our e-mails and the staff helped us to rearrange the whole trip when we missed a flight to Medan and arrived 2 nights later. Thanks!
title: Beautiful hotel, modern but very tasteful.

text: This beautiful haven in Medan was the perfect beginning and end to our 5 day trip to visit Lake Toba and the Batak villages.  The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff personable and well trained.  We only ate the Indonesian food which was very good indeed.  We particularly enjoyed the breakfast with home made bread and pineapple jam. Tri Jaya Travel is operated by the same people and the trip they offered to Lake Toba and the surrounding area was well run - excellent driver and English speaking driver, with good hotels along the way.  There is a lot of driving involved on poor roads but it is very interesting and we felt worthwhile.
title: A perfect start and end to our Sumatra trip

text: We had a great time in this hotel, after a two weeks travel in Sumatra. Staff and owners were very friendly and helped us when needed. The food was good, we liked the Dutch dishes which were also on the menu. There is a grocery store in the neighbourhood (less than 10 min. walk).
title: a good place to relax!

text:
This is a small boutique hotel with only eight rooms.  The rooms are exceptionally good – scrupulously clean, well laid out and a pleasure to be in.  Likewise the garden is a little tropical paradise.  There is also a good pool.

It is true that the hotel is under the airport approach path in certain weather conditions and, if you are a light sleeper who likes to lie in bed late, then maybe this isn’t the place for you.  Frankly, we didn’t find the noise to be a problem, largely as Medan is a small airport with few flights and no night flights.

The restaurant, in a separate block from the bedrooms, serves excellent breakfasts and good, though not exceptional, Indonesian and European main meals. 

Service throughout our time there was faultless, with friendly staff eager to look after us.  The hospitable owners, a Dutch academic and his wife, are a mine of information about North Sumatra and especially Medan.

Free internet access is available by Wifi or using the hotel’s own computer.  Free transfer from the airport, a twenty minute drive, is also offered.

We would definitely stay there again.
title: Charming place

text: Our family spent 3 nights at the hotel and did the 7 day tour of North Sumatra organised by the hotel.  We were there in the quiet season and had a fantastic time. we enjoyed all aspects of the hotel and the trip. I have never seen such beautiful surroundings and rarely have met people so friendly and accommodating.  The food was great and the dollar goes a long way.
title: An Undiscovered Gem

text:
If you looking for a place to stay in Medan, Hotel Deli River is a refreshing alternative to the standard hotels in the city. Albeit it being a further away from the city center, the advantage is it provides tranquility and quiet atmosphere to relax. 

There are 6 bungalow like rooms. The rooms are beautifully design and very comfortable. Breakfast is served on the terrace overseas the ponds, geese and the bungalows at the restaurant terrance. The restaurant provides a variety of food - Indonesia and Continental.  Internet is free and is accessible in the room or the restaurant. It also has a swimming pool overlooking the coast of Medan - a wonderful view.

Diana and Dirk, couple who owned the place are wonderful and friendly folks. Dirk, a historian and being Dutch will thrill you with stories of the history of Medan and be able to recommend some historical sites to visit. We did a city tour of medan to visit some of the historical sites and enjoyed it tremendously. They too can advise and arrange tours to other parts of Sumatra if required. We did not see other sites because we will too impatient to head on to Samosir ( island in Lake Toba).

Deli River Hotel - a wonderful place to relax and take in some history of Medan on your way to Lake Toba.

Kim & Robert - Malaysia
title: Away from the Maddening crowd - a refreshing stay

text:
Fine rooms in a beautiful garden. A good restaurant where you can eat indonesian and continental food, even with a bottle of wine.
The owners are very helpfull and mr. Dirk Buiskool, a dutch historian, will help you to make trips in Medan and in the surroundings (orang oetangs). See also Trijaya Tour & Travel
One of the best adresses in Sumatra we had in Indonesia
Jan en Anna van den Berg, Apeldoorn
title: An oasis in a busy town

text: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Beautiful gardens, with all sorts of plants. The restaurant is in a lovely traditional building and serves excellent food. The rooms are spotless, with silent a/c, kettle, veranda, nice furnishings. The staff are unobtrusive, efficient and friendly. There’s a really good pool with a lovely view down to the river. I can’t say enough good things about the place. We were only here for 2 nights at the start of our holiday and didn’t feel the need to set foot outside until it was sadly time to move on.
title: Paradise

text:
A wonderful gem in Medan out of the hustle of the city. Beautifully done, It has everything you need but kept simple without any unnecessary fuss. 
Lovely staff. Good kitchen. Great atmosphere. A little destination in itself. Lush vegetation and a. pristine pool. 
It has a sense of personal character. 
They also run tours of Medan and Indonesia. 
I can highly recommend.
title: A gem in Medan

text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Deli River. The rooms are massive, beautiful and kept clean throughout our stay. The property is amazing with lots of greenery. The main house/building has 2 big restaurant spaces (1 for breakfast and 1 for lunch/dinner) where their delicious food is served. Definitely try out the bitterballen (we had to being Dutch)!
There's also a great pool to swim in and relax by.
It is located just a little bit outside Medan so not ideal if you're there to really visit Medan (unless you're willing to get a driver), but we enjoyed it so much at the property that we didn't leave. It is however relatively close (1hr drive) to the airport so perfect if you want to relax a little before you fly.
Would highly recommend!
title: Large rooms on amazing property

text: If you want to have a ‘whow’ experience and you need to go to Medan: this is it! Small scale hotel with maximum service to exceed your expectations. Rooms are perfect clean and neat. Restaurant staff treats you like king. And they can improvise: they can arrange a private tour to the volcano’s, historical buildings sightseeing, jungle track walking experience when you arrive. This hotel has all the connections!
title: The ‘whow’ experience with Deli River Hotel

text:
Stayed here for a couple of nights great staff, good food, lovely location, pool and beautiful gardens, the rooms had all the facilities, maybe a bit isolated, great views, wonderful sunsets.
A nice relaxing location to rest over
title: great hideaway

text:
I would challenge anyone to find a more serene and beautiful hotel escape in Medan. From the moment you drive into the property, you are captivated by the charm of your surroundings. It was the perfect location to commence and conclude my jungle and wildlife adventures in the jungles and surroundings of North Sumatra (which were also organised by the hotel/Tri Jaya tour and travel). It really was the perfect place to unwind and recharge after a long-haul flight, surrounded by the well-kept and manicured garden, great food, and the wonderfully attentive staff. All these made my stay at Hotel Deli River such a pleasure to travel to and spend time in Medan.

The fusion cuisine, vegetarian food options, homemade/grown breads/spreads/vegetables/spices, happy hour and freshly brewed single origin local coffee were all exceptional (especially breakfast). I was also fortunate enough to be staying on a Saturday evening where a live DJ session was also offered. It was a wonderful atmosphere and opportunity to meet some locals.

Thank you so much for such a wonderful experience and stay.
title: The best in Medan!

text: lovely garden, nice food, swimming pool etc. The hotel is very well situated between 2 mosques both using amplified automated electronic prayers starting at 5am. This is great - you can enjoy the prayers from the conmfort of your bed. Also quite rightly conversation at dinner is impossible -  better to focus on prayer. Beyond that students of urban sprawl will find plenty of study material on the doorstep. The concierge was very happy to let me carry my own case up the stairs
title: handy for the mosque

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your review. In reaction to your complain about sounds from outside we have put extra isolation in all rooms as well as automatic door closers to minimize sounds from outside. So far very few guests complained about this matter. On the contrary, the majority of our guests praised the quiet and relaxed atmosphere of Hotel Deli River and did not mention any sounds from outside. Considering the assistance of carrying your luggage, our staff always offers to assist with the luggage. In your case you already had carried it yourself so quickly to the room before our staff could have helped you. We are a small scale eco-friendly family hotel in a tropical garden with over 20 species of tropical birds in our compound. We will always do our utmost to offer our guests a nice stay in our hotel. Management Hotel Deli River.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Hotel Deli River is our last hotel during our trip to Sumatra.
This is the best hotel. We love the Indonesian food, nasi rendang and the nice  sate . 
The restaurant area is very convenient area  to sit and enjoy the green environment . The staff is great 👍 The swimming pool area is clean.
I recommend this hotel highly ❤❤❤
title: We will come again

owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your kind review.
We are looking forward to welcoming you here again
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We enjoyed our weekend stay in this hotel.
Lovely place with professional staff.
Excellent food and if you are in the restaurant area you are in a five stars resort.
The swimming pool is clean and surrounded by green trees. Even some locals swim with their daily dress in the pool and the staff of the hotel tried to address this to the guests.  We appreciate the effort of the staff to solve this kind of problem to maintain the hygiene of their pool.  We saw this on the spot.

We will come back again to this place
title: We enjoyed our weekend stay in this hotel

owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your sweet review.
It was nice to have you as our guests in our hotel. 🌺🌸🙏
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We celebrated our second wedding anniversary in Hotel Deli River. The staff arranged a beautiful candle light dinner for us and the meal was delicious. We enjoyed staying in the nice comfortable mosquito screened room. Beautiful garden. We loved to watch the geese in the pond in front of our room. The staff was so friendly and helpfull. Everything  was great. We will come again.
title: An excellent hotel

owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your excellent review. We are looking forward to welcoming you again in the future
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The last school study tour I took to North Sumatra stayed in a hotel in central Medan, but this time I brought a group of 20 students and staff to Hotel Deli River. While a central hotel was closer to shopping and malls, it was also very hot and the students did not feel safe when leaving the hotel. In contrast, Hotel Deli River is outside the city, with green gardens, a lovely pool and a safe environment. At the airport, we were greeted by wonderful staff in traditional dress and one of the owners, Bu Diana came to meet us herself. The staff and students enjoyed our stay at the start and end of our Sumatran road trip. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and the restaurant is excellent. Hotel Deli River is also helping us to minimise our plastic usage with water refills available. Thank you for taking care of us!
title: School Tour stay

text: The beautiful natural environment that has been created is amazing, so impressed that the kitchen is able to grow and use so many of their own fruit and vegetables. Really love that they have a focus on being environmentally sustainable and reducing plastic waste too. The staff are so kind and friendly, and they do an incredible job at the breakfast spread that's a little different every morning. Highly highly recommended! Clean, tidy and well-presented rooms, great pool and outdoor areas also, good wifi too.
title: Beautiful, relaxing and highly recommended

text: Following a fall in the jungle and hospitalisation I needed a place to recover before flying home.  And luckily I found Deli River.  With its excellent facilities, good food and lovely grounds it was the perfect place.  But what really makes it special are the friendly, helpful and welcoming staff.
title: R & R

text:
We stayed here for one night to catch our flight next day after our tour around Karo and Samosir. Staff was very competent, followed us to the room and oriented us to everything. Love it that they take extra care for the environment by providing a reusable bottle to hold drinking water. 

The hot water was not that great, can consider looking into replacing it with a better heater.
title: Relaxing stay!

text:
We spent one night in the honeymoon suite. We wish we had stayed longer. It was the nicest accommodation we had out of all Indonesia, including Bali!

The bathroom had the best fixtures and water pressure we'd seen anywhere in Indonesia. The bed was wonderfully large and comfortable. It's hard, but we have a memory foam mattress back home, so we're accustomed to firm.

I can't say enough good things about the immaculately manicured grounds. it was a pleasure walking around them. It was also nice and quiet, being removed from the busy street. And the property is surrounded by green space as well. 

The main building, where the dining hall is located, made us feel like we were at a five-star resort. Breakfast was more than we could eat, service was great, and we really wanted to stay longer at the Hotel Deli River. Even if you're just passing through Medan like we were, spend an extra night or two. You won't regret it.
title: Wish we had stayed longer!

photos.caption: View of the main dining hall from across the lotus pond.

text: It's a green oasis in the middle of busy Medan. An amazing garden with pool overlooking the river was the perfect place to relax after our long journeys into the interior. But the best part of this hotel is the supper friendly staff!  We made this our base for three separate adventures and they took great care of our things.
title: Family Holiday in Sumatra

text: If you want to visit Medan, the hotel is perfect. Outside from city center with nice set up with excellent food and swimming pool.you can also book different tours from the hotel or company in all Sumatra.
title: Medan and around

text: This was my second stay at this excellent eco-friendly hotel with pool in a relaxing tropical environment, located outside the city center. My room was clean, very well kept, no-smoking, equipped with AC and WiFi, included a different very creative breakfast every morning. Dinner at Omlandia restaurant includes Indonesian and Western food. Room and food are very reasonably priced. The owners and staff are multilingual and very customer oriented. I will definitely be back at this hotel for my next trip to this exotic and friendly country. Highly recommended.
title: Excellent and relaxing atmosphere

text:
I had an amazing stay at Hotel Deli River. it is like a sanctuary and very beautiful.
The rooms are big, clean, beds very comfortable and the bathrooms have a great shower. The rooms have air con and everything is styled very beautifully.

The hotel has a great service. Excellent food and service. The breakfast is amazing. 
Staff speak english and the owners of the hotel are fluent in Dutch and English. I really recommend Hotel Deli River - a sanctuary in Medan.
title: Amazing Stay at Hotel Deli River

text: Medan is probably not a city you would love at the first glance, not too many attractions and a bit sad. The more you might be in need of a decent place to stay there. Hotel Deli River might be the place for you. Attentive stuff, good food, nice garden makes value for money.
title: Sweet lush gardens

text:
After a 2-weeks journey in the north-west area of Sumatra we stayed for two days in this wonderfull hotel. It was a surprise to find such a paradise after riding through very crowded streets of Medan. Well hidden, nice tropical garden and pond. Building all well maintained. 
Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Food and drink were very good, high standard. 
The pool in the back of the hotel had a nice view on the river and helped us to come at ease after our journey.
Unforgettable experience. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we hope to go back there in the future.
title: Daily enjoyable!

text: Just arrived in Medan and had pre booked Hotel Deli River. Exceptional room and service, especially for the very reasonable price! Several staff speak English and their customer service was first class. A great breakfast is included in the price and the delicious evening meal was superb and also reasonable. Do yourself a favor and stay here when staying in Medan. .
title: Wow! Great place to start or end trip to Sumatra

text: It was one of the best hotel experiences we ever had so far, my wife and I. The staff is very friendly and professional. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. It was a real pleasure to stay in this natural and eco-friendly environment. We also had the opportunity to have indonesian cooking lessons.
title: A dream place to relax

text: Stayed here for 1 night pre heading out on tour. Hotel grounds were very nice and relaxing. Staff were great and food from restaurant was tasty and reasonably priced. The room was nice however bathroom could do with an upgrade, both shower and toilet leaked and shower setup made it impossible to keep water inside the bath (had a shub). Some new towels would be nice also as these were old and thin. Overall, stay was good and with a bathroom update this hotel would be worth 5/5.
title: Relaxing Location

text:
What a beautiful green place to relax! We are on our bikes and explore the area from here by bike. 
Since we are 3 months on the road we have to work through it (computer work) and this quiet place is perfect for that. Besides, we enjoy a few rounds in the swimming pool, the service, the conversations, the wonderful breakfast, the fragrant daily fresh flowers in the room and much more.
Simply perfect!
A real wonderful extra: here they take great care to avoid plastic. That's why you can get water in a recyclable bottle if you need it, whenever you need it.
title: Perfect mix of culture and comfort

text: Deli River is a nice little hotel in southern Medan. We landed late and wanted to have a spot too sleep to head on to lake Toba the next day. The room was clean and well maintained but it seemed a bit smaller than the advertised 42sqm, unless you include the patio. The curtains don’t block a lot of light. If you easily wake up due to sunlight you will have an early start to the day. The place is not cheap but still on the acceptable side. The breakfast was simple but the Mie Goreng were some of the best I ever had.
title: Nice little hotel

text:
The Hotel Deli River oozes old world charm. The main house welcomes guests with wide open windows, high ceilings, and elegant yet charming rooms. The whole grounds offer a haven from Medan’s bustle. We enjoyed a dip in the swimming pool upon our arrival, as well as a restful nap on the lounge chairs. The Olandia restaurant is scrumptious. Some reviewers have complained that the hotel is far from the main city (12 km). It is perhaps so, but who wants to eat out when one of the city’s best restaurants is right on the grounds of the hotel? As we were staying there before and after a trek in Bukit Lawang, we had quite a few meals. We sampled many Indonesian dishes, which all tasted refined. Try the soto ayam or the eggplant dish, for instance, or even the rendang or the sate ayam. However, leave some room for the apple pie (baked the Dutch way). Since I’m speaking of food, the breakfast is very good and plentiful. The food is fresh, from the baked goods to the fruits and the home-baked bread.
Finally, the rooms are spacious and airy. Each of them includes a patio where it’s nice to just sit and read. Our only complaint here was that it would be nice to have non-smoking patios, as all are shared with a neighbour. We had to go into our bedroom, because our neighbour’s smoke was bothering us.
Lastly, most of the staff was helpful and welcoming. However, a few, especially in the restaurant, seemed more interested in their cellphones than in serving customers. That puzzled us, and on a couple of occasions, we decided not to order dessert, because staff didn’t seem too intested in serving us. 
That was good for our waistline, perhaps not for the business’ bottomline.
title: Beautiful tranquillity

text: I stayed here before and after a jungle camping trek. This is a really relaxing place, as soon as you leave the hustle and bustle of the streets and the wacky races driving there is peace and calm. The restaurant serves excellent food and drinks, including a very good breakfast overlooking the well kept gardens and pond. The room was very comfortable, i would definitely recommend this place.
title: City hotel

text: We were completely satisfied with our stay. Excellent service, food was great and the swimming pool is huge and clean. Could spend the whole day just chilling in the pool and get a nice tan! As a vegetarian, I would highly recommend to try the pecel and gado gado at the restaurant! It was so good that for someone like me, who's never had Indonesian food before to fall in love with it after having it once!! The staff were very polite and spoke good English as well. The room was spacious with air conditioning. Overall, a great experience with Hotel Deli River, and would definitely visit the hotel once again if I ever get back to Medan!
title: Excellent service

text: This hotel has a great staff, it’s a beautiful accomodation and the food is also really great. The ambiance is really relaxed. The hotel is also ecological and that makes it even more great. If you want to do something in the surroundings , you can always ask the staff and they will give you advice and arrange something. I had a great experience here and I recommend the hotel too everyone; families, business trips, couples and more.
title: Amazing!

text:
We highly recommend Hotel Deli River. We enjoyed 2 stays with 1 night in July and 2 nights in August being pre and post trekking in the Gunung Leuser National Park in Ketambe. 

Hotel Deli River is surrounded by lush tropical gardens and is an absolute oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Medan. The Hotel Deli River and Restaurant Omlandia provides a most relaxed, tranquil and serene ambience. The magnificent swimming pool is located at the edge of the valley facing the Deli River with the spectacular Sumatran Jungle as its backdrop. Simply stunning! 

The Hotel Deli River staff are wonderfully warm and welcoming, continually smiling and always eager to provide assistance with whatever is required. Indeed, we were provided with a lovely breakfast box upon a 6:30am departure for the lengthy drive to Ketambe and again upon our 4:30am departure to catch a flight back to Bali. 

Syahfitri and all of the absolutely lovely staff made our stay a truly memorable experience. Excellent location, accommodation, service, staff and food. We highly recommend The Hotel Deli River and eagerly look forward to our next stay.
title: "Wonderful Oasis"

text:
I thank the hotel Deli River and also the staff to have welcomed me so well.

The rooms are equipped with accommodations which are very comfortable, you already have anything you want, you cannot miss something.

The traditional Indonesian food is very tasty and healthy, i really loved it and i had my best breakfast ever.

I also wanted to thank Syahfitri, Rina and Lala who have helped me so much, they are helpful and very friendly as well.

My regards

Léo.
title: Holidays

text: After a drive from Parapat to Medan we arrived in our hotel, tranquil. The setting is beautiful and except for the mosque calling for prayer it is really quiet. The restaurant offers indonesian and international food, with a dutch twist. What I really like is they make an effort to reduce, reuse and recycle in a exceptional way.
title: Tranquil

text: This hotel had outstanding customer service. We felt right at home from the moment we arrived. The facilities were neat and tidy and the rooms were beautifully decorated and comfortable. The restaurant served great tasting food too. Would recommend :)
title: Warm and welcoming hotel. Very pleasant experience.

text: This hotel is an oasis in beautiful surroundings. Clean spacious rooms and a very nice restaurant and pool. Very friendly staff and excellent service. We came back three times in the hotel on our 3 week trip in Sumatra and we truly enjoyed our stay in this hotel.
title: Very pleasant stay at this hotel. Friendly staff and excellent service.

text:
Nice and cosy hotel with clean and spacious cottages.
Friendly staff and also a nice restaurant,serving great Indonesian dishes.
We were able to store our dive equipment there,when we stayed in the jungle in Bukit lawang.
Really nice garden,including a pool.
Great place to recover from your flight,before starting to explore the North of Sumatra.
title: Nice and quiet spot

text: The Deli River is a very nice Hotel in Medan. It has a main house with cottages arranged around a little garden with a lake. The restaurant is hosted in the main house. Although we arrived late in the evening, they served us very delicious Indonesian food. Our room had A/C and was very clean.  There's also a pool in the backyard which we didn't use. As we traveled from the hotel to Bukit Lawang it was no problem to keep parts of our luggage there until we come back.
title: Nice cottages, delicious food

text:
I visited this hotel with my family in occasion of my holidays.
It is nice to stay there and the service is excellent. 
They take care of the customer and do all their best to give what customers need.
title: Nice stay

text: My second trip to this hotel, the last time I stayed I loved it and it’s still a nice option in Medan. The rates seem to increased significantly and I think it’s way over priced, particularly for this region.
title: Disappointed

owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying in our hotel.

It is not fair to write that we have increased our price significantly. 

In 5 years time the price of our room has been increased with 6 US$.

We have to pay decent salaries to our staff and take care of all the maintenance of the hotel. 

You were in our hotel in 2013 when our rate was Rp, 700.000 per room per night for a deluxe cottage. At that time the rate for 1 US$ was around Rp.10.000. 


From 1st of July until 15th of September 2018 our high season rate is Rp. 810.000. Now 1 US$ is equal to Rp 14.500. 


From 15th of September 2018 during low season the price of a deluxe cottage in our hotel is Rp. 750.000.  

Please calculate also devaluation in Indonesia. 

We are a small scale hotel of only 14 rooms. We have to maintain our rooms, swimming pool and our  large garden as the concept of our hotel is eco friendly green environment. We use a lot of fresh ingredients from our garden in our kitchen. We strive to give the best service to our guests with the limited rooms that we have. 

We hope our explanation is clear

Management of hotel Deli  River
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Nice and very well equipped hotel. A/C, big and comfortable beds. Hot shower. nice swimming pool.
The negative point is the restaurant, a bit expensive and not so good as expected /price. Don't try the so said "western" food. Enjoy the indonesian cuisine elsewhere.
title: Excellent hotel, mixed feelings about the restaurant

text: The arboretum like setting of this hotel brings you to the best of tropical Asia! Rooms welcome you with fresh flower arrangements, are spacious with beautiful views from a large balcony. Every staff member staff is super friendly, professional and accomodating to your schedule. Morning breakfast served overlooking the garden with an amazing array of deliciousness! Don't forget to take a dip in the large pool overlooking the river and gardens!!
title: Perfect Retreat

text:
Hotel Deli River was a rest stop after leaving Pulau Weh while we arranged the last 2 weeks of our holiday. We wanted something away from the city with a bit of luxury as a little treat in between our backpacking holiday & extremely happy with our choice.
The staff were wonderful, the rooms large & comfortable with a great shower. As per other reviews, this really is an oasis & would recommend Hotel Deli River to others.
title: Medan Luxury

text:
This property is gorgeous with big size rooms. The staff is amazing too and will take care of anything you need with a big smile on their face. 

The breakfast they provided was very good, everything was fresh. Ww also had dinner two nights here and were not disappointed.  It is definitely expensive than what you can get outside but worth it. There is anyway nothing close to the resort for you to go out and sample unless you are willing to walk and speak the local language. 

We also tried their travel service for airport pickip and trip to Lake Toba. Although slightly expensive, the service was great.  

The soundproofing in the rooms is not good and you can hear sounds drom outside if anybody passes or talks.
title: Fantastic stay

text:
We stayed 2 nights at the start of a long trip around several islands of Indonesia and what a place for our first insight into this fabulous country! This small hotel is located 18km outside central Medan and about 40 minutes from the airport. The only reason I've given 4 stars is distance from any significant local amenties (and lack of choice for breakfasts) but if you don't mind not straying far it would be hard to beat this place. Can't recommend highly enough.

Service was excellent, food was good, if a little short on choice, especially at breakfasts when fixed plates were provided (we think this was due to there being so few guests); the grounds are beautiful with a small infinity pool looking straight down into dense forest and Deli River below; the rooms are large and comfortable with verandahs great for just soaking up the view and atmosphere. 

The best thing about the hotel is the amazing staff who were always laughing & smiling infectiously and keen to try out their English and chat about Indonesian life when they had time. We returned for another night at the end of our time in Sumatra and the staff welcomed us like long lost family.

We did arrange a becak tour to take us out into nearby countryside for a morning and especially enjoyed strolling through fields growing every kind of veg & fruit and laughing and joking with local farmers despite the language barrier!
title: Gorgeous and the staff made us feel like family!!

text:
A relaxing oasis in busy Medan. Beautifully decorated and very welcoming and kind staff. If you want to explore Medan, recharge from a visit to the jungle or prepare for departure by airplane go to Deli River and you will be pleasantly surprised. 

We stayed for two nights at the end of our Java - Sumatra trip. Great recharge after Bukit Lawang and a nice relaxing end to our trip. 

The place is relatively large for the few rooms it offers and therefore feels spacious. Everything you see around you is green, well decorated. 

The rooms are comfortable and offer tea, coffee, drinking water (hotel makes an effort to reduce waste), bathroom with bath, a/c, television, good wireless internet, desk, deck with chairs and view on the garden, mini bar, good bed and some art. 

The restaurant is nicely designed and offers a natural flow of wind supported by fans. You can sit inside or outside. The staff speaks English and provides good explanations on the dishes. The food is delicious and freshly made. Indonesian, Chinese and European dishes available. And some Dutch specialities (kroket, bitterbal, ..). The food is amazing and reasonably priced. 

Breakfast is served to order or via buffet. You can order additional food if you want at no extra charge. 

The hotel arranged a very nice heritage tour as well as airport shuttle for us. Good reliable driver. 

If you want to go and explore Medan you can order a taxi or catch a Grab (local Uber- works very well!). 

The hotel offers a lush garden and beautiful swimming pool.

To summarise: look no further and stay here at this boutique hotel with lovely staff, comfortable facilities and relaxing environment.
title: Best hotel in Medan

text: Wonderful hotel situated in beautiful grounds. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. The breakfast and evening meal were delicious. The room was clean and very comfortable. Swimming pool was clean and larger than expected. They even provided insect repellent if you chose an outside table at dinner. Laundry service was fast and super efficient. Highly recommend
title: Grown up gap year

text: Stayed 2 nights on the way back from Bukit Lawang.Driving from the chaotic Medan roads into the driveway of Deli river ,you are met with a calm and serene beautiful colonial style house and gardens with a large lake . There was only 2 other guest so the place was very quiet, lovely and peaceful. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the food was good, we stayed with the local dishes which were very tasty.  The room was spacious and beautifully decorated with everything you need for a couple of nights stop, beds were so comfortable.The grounds are lovely and serene with a nice pool if the weather is good, nothing really outside the grounds so transport needed to go anywhere. The morning breakfast was a highlight,  being served on lovely linen table cloths looking out to the lake was very nice and the home made bread and pastries were delicious, served with eggs and fruit, the whole service was excellent.  Staff were lovely and friendly which made our stay very pleasant indeed.
title: Beautiful oasis.

text:
Well arranged pick up at the airport by their best driver, Yul, who also speaks a little bit Dutch. Deli River is a nice place with a large pond and beautiful garden, little bit outside Medan. They also have a swimming pool. The big rooms (cottages) are very comfortable with a terrace overlooking the pond. Nice, friendly and cheerful singing staff always trying to make your stay as pleasant as possible. You feel immediately at home.
Breakfast is nice, with fresh fruits, juices, marmalade and homemade cakes. If there are many guest there is a buffet otherwise you will be served at your table. And at dinnertime they serve different delicious western and local meals. As it is an open air restaurant they provide anti mosquito, a nice service. The restaurant is also overlooking the pond.
Deli River is just outside Medan, so they can arrange a taxi for you if you don't have a car, e.g. a Blue Bird. But you can also use Grab (just took over Uber in Southeast Asia). Grab is also useful for getting around in Medan because it's difficult to catch a cab in town.
Their driver, Yul, brought us to the ferry at lake Toba, a whole day drive because we asked for the touristic route. Very nice and interesting. And Yul was very entertaining.
title: Oasis in hectic Medan.

text:
We were happy to stay two nights at this oasis of tranquility in the outskirts of Medan on a recent business trip. A hotel driver successfully picked us up at the airport; the transfer journey was long and smoggy, however (well over an hour), because of rush hour arrival. Everything was up to reported standards of excellence, especially the food and the service. Breakfast was just a continental breakfast, however, not the usual spread and wide choice of dishes usually available in Asian hotels. Be aware of this if you need something more substantial to get a good start to the day.

The only curious thing about the room we stayed in is the fact that the air-conditioning unit was mounted so that it faces AWAY from the main part of the room and into the bathroom, i.e. away from the bed instead of onto it – where most likely you'll be relaxing and trying to cool off from the humid heat outside. Because of this we found it hard to cool down as expected; it took over 20 minutes of indirect air-con to cool down, in fact.

Also be aware that there's a chorus of muezzins that call to prayer in the early morning hours and again at night; this may affect your sleep. Personally I'm used to it from travelling in Turkey, Morocco, etc.
title: Very nice but slow place to chill

text:
This gem is located approx. 50 minutes' drive from Medan airport. Just outside the city which is worth every extra minute. We enjoyed staying in the lush gardens. Some of the 14 rooms have a view from their balcony. The rooms are simple but functional. With airco blowing in the right direction (not being your face/bed). The shower has warm water, a toilet and small washing basin. There are rooms with double and two single beds. A fridge could be placed in the room at request. There is a rather big swimming pool but due to safety measurements it is not really possible to have a good swim. Wonderful view into the valley from the pool.
The restaurant serves nice food and is a cozy place to sit and spend some hours. Breakfast especially was superb. Lots of variation, nice prepared dishes, fruit and fresh fruit juice, home baked bread. Really fantastic. The owners travel agency facilitated a well-organized trip to Lake Toba for us. Excellent price/quality balance.
title: FANTASTIC breakfast in lovely setting

text:
As a first-timer to Sumatra, I chose this property as my base to start and conclude my adventure. Not having experienced Indonesia much, besides touristic Bali, it was a welcome change to make the choice to discover North Sumatra's landscape of natural-beauty. Hotel Deli River was no exception to this, a true garden-oasis in the heart of the big-city and jungle. 

My boyfriend and I stayed in the Deluxe cottage. From our balcony we could unwind, relax, enjoy and appreciate our surroundings that overlooked the pond and its resident geese. The bedding was comfortable, bathrooms were clean, room was naturally-lit throughout the day, spacious and airy. There was also a convenience store located nearby, within walking distance (within/approx 200m) which was also great. One thing we also noticed was the property had ramps throughout, making it completely accessible and wheelchair-friendly for everyone to enjoy! 

The property was located just outside of the city-centre. The staff were so friendly, very well-informed and attentive to assist in arranging our transportation, to both, the city-centre and our trips to Lake Toba, Bukit Lawan, including to Borobudur in Yogyakarta! 

The charming ambience of the restaurant was the perfect accompaniment to the freshly-prepared meals restaurant Omlandia provided. Being vegetarian, I was excited to see they offered tempe and eggplant toasted sandwiches, so delicious! Their extensive menu should satisfy the fussiest of eaters.

The pool overlooks the hotels vegetable/spice garden and the Deli river. It was well kept and maintained. With direct sun exposure within the pool and natural shade provided over the lounge, it was my ticket to relaxation.

The positive accounts and information obtained online through our research done prior to our stay, in our opinion, are true to detail. However, the friendliness, the warmth, the expertise and attention to detail of the staff, especially the owners, can only be captured and appreciated through a first-hand encounter. 

To the management of Hotel Deli River, thank you for creating this space, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Upon our return back to Sumatra, we will definitely return to this property and recommend to our friends and family.
title: We loved our stay!

text:
A true oasis in Medan. Ended our holiday in Sumatra at Deli River and felt truly spoilt. We had the pool to ourselves all day and enjoyed a delicious breakfast on the terrace. 
Staff were very professional and could not have been more helpful.

Thoroughly recommended.
title: Beautiful hotel in Medan

text:
We had a fantastic 3 night stay in December. The staff are so nice and accommodating.
The food in the onsite restaurant (omlandia) is delicious, we had breakfast lunch and dinner everyday we were there. 
The beds are lovely and comfortable with the rooms a good size.
The pool is nice for a relaxing dip.
title: wonderful relaxing hotel

text: Hotel deli river is simply a lovely place to enjoy whilst holidaying in Medan. The accommodation is clean, staff are very helpful, grounds are beautiful and food (especially the breakfast) was always delicious !
title: Beautiful

text:
This hotel and its private grounds form a welcoming oasis within the big city bustle of Medan.  A pond with geese separates the bungalow style room buildings from the restaurant and reception building (and pool area).  You know you’re in a fast growing Asian city - during our stay the call to prayer from a mosque mingled with the singing of Christmas hymns from an evangelical church - but you’re as removed from the city as you want to be.  
The breakfasts were excellent, with personalized touches.  The staff was delightful.  The fine, roomy, high-ceilinged restaurant serves traditional Indonesian and Dutch dishes (gado gado, saté, soto ayam; bitterballen en patatjes met...). The Dutch owner of the hotel is a historian who’s written books about Medan and the Dutch colonial times.  His Indonesian wife arranges tours with guides and drivers.  Our tours in Medan and to the Lake Toba region were tip-top.  
Hotel, restaurant and tours get our unqualified recommendation.
title: Oasis in Medan

photos.caption: the restaurant as seen from the rooms

text:
Went here for the Omlandia cafe/restaurant in one rainy afternoon. The weather was just right, my friends and I had coffee, fried banana platter and enjoyed the afternoon there. Perfect for group of families and friends for gatherings or other functions. Place was big and comfortable enough albeit old-fashioned (but it's what they sell actually the classic vintage atmosphere surounded by lush greenery). Price was reasonable too.
Location not very easy to find, you really have to own good driving skills because along the way you will pass narrow streets on hilly landscape, but the journey from downtown medan area was worth it. it totally had the serene, peaceful ambient and comfortable setting to enjoy.
title: went here for the cafe (Omlandia Restaurant)

text:
The setting of Hotel Deli River is very elegant. The garden is beautiful and the bungalows are more or less spread out in the area. The staff is very, very kind and always ready to assist and interested in your well being. The location is quite far from the center, but with a grabcar app we traveled very efficiently and cheap to the city and back again. The breakfast is nice with a mixture of European and Indonesian food.
Our room was spacious and very pleasant to stay in. Although Medan is not spectacular, Hotel Deli River is a good place to spend one or more nights.
title: Gardensetting on the outskirts of a busy town

text: This is a great hotel to kick back for a few days before or after trip to interior. Wonderful, attentive staff. The room was clean and well equipped as are the massive lodge, kitchen and dining area. Beautiful grounds as well. Overall an excellent hotel.
title: wonderful hotel in Medan

text: A very special place amidst busy Medan that feels like a safe haven. A beautiful central building with very good restaurant and swimming pool overlooking the Deli River. A beautiful well kept garden / park with a pond and homegrown spices and flowers they use in the kitchen and for decoration. Beautiful private rooms that make you feel at home, very comfortable, each with your own terrace. The staff is extremely friendly and the absolute PLUS are the owners: very knowledgeable about the Dutch heritage in Sumatra but also all the sweet spots of both Medan and Sumatra. Diana and Dirk are very special warm people that love to share all they know. We did a memory lane trip to my mothers early youth when she lived in Medan in the 1940’s. It was both emotional as interesting! Our driver and guide Yoel already working for over 15 years for Deli River topped it all, he showed us around Sumatra in a week and we laughed all the time and learned lots!! We hated to say goodbye!!!!
title: A sanctuary in hectic Medan

text: Before  going there u must recovsr yourself from mosquito 😊. This place is silince and u can feel in jungle. After 9 pm reseption and restrant close  in hotel .u should buy something if u need eat midnight
title: 🤐

text:
Awesome hotel surrounded by greenery.It's a place for resting albeit close by crowded city of Medan.Spacious and good equipped rooms with terrace.
Amazing staff of the hotel makes you do not have to worry about anything.
Thank You!!!
title: Wonderful place!!!

text: We stayed 3 nights and again 1 night after touring around. It is beautifully located, surrounded by green nature, one feels far removed from busy city life. All staff are friendly, attentive and helpful, Elly in particular goes out of her way to make you feel at home. The rooms are clean and up to date, the beds comfortable. Everything is in top condition. The dining room is open and airy and the restaurant offers delicious food served with great care. Breakfast is elaborate and served with a view of the garden. The swimming pool is an additional plus, good to cool off after a visit to Medan.
title: An oasis of tranquility

text:
Had a pleasant two nights stay here.
Staff delightful, calm settings and bathroom looked very new.

Only downsides was a very loud wedding the first night (but that's probably beyond hotel control), TV is very small and wifi in room a bit patchy.

Overall recommended if want something different from the usual international luxury chains, and don't mind staying outside the city (i picked it for that very reason).

Good restaurant too!
title: Very pleasant stay slightly outside Medan

text:
Stayed here for 2 nights. This place is wonderful: a quite and peaceful get-away from busy Medan. The hotel has a colonial look-n-feel, combined with jungle-atmosphere. 

The hosts are really friendly and always ready to help. The rooms are wonderful! Unlike other reviews, no problem with the mosquito's (as long as you keep the front door closed). They have a cosy balcony, large beds, television, closeth and a desk. The bathroom was very clean and best shower I had over all of Indonesia. 

The pool is a nice extra and you can also take a book from the extensive book collection.

The diner menu offers a rich choise of local and western food. The quality is great. I recommend the chicken with Indonesian spices (but take a small side dish to go with that).

Highly recommended hotel!
title: Peaceful piece of paradise

text:
Hotel pick up was a welcome relief after 3 flights from the UK. After about an hours drive we arrived at hotel but it was dark so limited views.
Staff very friendly and explained restaurant was shut but they could make something if we were hungry. 4 large cold beers was enough.

Good sized family room but no nets so a few bites though Next morning we saw how close we were to the lake so we weren't surprised. 
Inside and outside shower - we enjoyed the outside one watched by a squirrel.
Grounds looked nice. 

Found breakfast disappointing after the previous reviews. Beautiful room with nice views but that is probably where it stops. One table was set with a cloth but reserved. For the others even though there were plenty of staff around you need to set your own. Lots of small dishes with bits of fruit, cakes, rice etc but for our 1st breakfast in Sumatra not quite what we expected. No offer of eggs/omelettes.

When I compare this with the huge fruit platters and banana pancakes to die for prepared,later in the week, in the middle of the jungle on open fires it's probably just 5/10 for effort.
title: Quiet pretty location but a little over rated.

owner_response.text:
Dear guest, 

Thank you for your comment. 
We would like to clarify certain issues that you have pointed out 🙂 

1. Mosquitos
We often notice that guests sit on the private terrace in front of their room with the door open. We have made an announcement in all rooms that guests better keep the room doors closed to prevent the mosquitoes from entering. All the windows of our rooms are equipped with mosquito screens. Mosquitos cannot enter the room if windows and doors are closed.

2. Breakfast
Our breakfast on the day when you were in our hotel was a buffet breakfast so every guest served  themselves. The breakfast consisted of :
-Toast from home made bread.
- Butter, honey, strawberry jam. Furthermore, we served our home-made pineapple jam which is a favourite of our guests.
-Cinnamon rolls, coconut bread (homemade and fresh from our kitchen)

-Scrambled eggs. We put them in the pan stove to keep it warm. We hope that you have seen this pan stove. 

-If you ask our staff for an omelete we will be happy to prepare this for you. 😊🌺🌸
-Curry puff ( curry pie)
-Nasi goreng and lemper ayam (fried rice and sticky rice with coconut and slices of chicken for our gluten free diet guests.
-Fresh fruits like pineapple, papaya, banana. Also fresh vegetables such as cucumber and tomatoes.
-Fresh pineapple and papaya juice, freshly blended in our kitchen. The fruits are often from our own garden.
-Coffee and tea.

3. Prepared table
The prepared table with table cloth was for a birthday celebration. For this special day we put extra flowers and a table cloth as a surprise for the guest.

4. Daily variations and special requests
Every day we serve different dishes for breakfast, if guests stay more than 1 night they will have different choice of  breakfast. In case of special requests like gluten free dishes we prepare that on the breakfast table. We also include traditional Indonesian breakfast dishes. 
Our utmost priority is that our guests enjoy their stay as much as possible, and therefore we try to cater to the different needs of our guests. 

Terima kasih,

Management of Hotel Deli River
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I stayed at the Deli River Hotel with a friend. Our room was very comfortable. We were offered to have room service waiting for us since we had a late flight in. The food was excellent. Everyone made sure that our stay was fantastic, Elly especially made sure that we were able to make the most of our time in Sumatra. We're planning on returning there on our next trip to Medan.
title: Great place to stay

text: Well, we were only here for one night going to Bukit Lawang. Unfortunately due to delays we only arrived at 10pm with a leave at 9.00am next morning. Even though food in the restaurant had closed they went above and beyond to bring some curry and beers and drinks to the room and set it all out in our room for us. Nets on the beds, no mossy bites ( but we are in Sumatra after all ). Had the pool to myself in the morning at 7.30 for a swim and stretches. Breakfast was perfectly okay overlooking the pond and ducks. The staff were very helpful. Great first night to the holiday.
title: Great Service, Fab stop over

text:
Ok, so I booked this place as a result of the great reviews, and normally tripadvisor is near enough the mark.. not on this one;-

The Good:
-Friendly staff
-Nice pool
-Nice grounds (but way smaller than they look in photos.. this place isn't big)
-they pack you breakfast for an early flight
- you can get a really awesome massage from a blind couple they use which is great value

The Bad:
-Mosquitos are abundant..we came here from Bukit Lawang in the jungle to stay here and it was much worse here- tons of bites despite repellent 
- The room. We had a family room. Beds didn't have nets and they are needed. The walls had multiple blood stains and smears from previous successful mosquito kills- gross. The windows locks were broken and windows could only be pulled closed and not fastened meaning we couldn't relax with our belongings unattended in the room! The TV in the room is an ornament as the fuzzy picture is unwatchable! 
-The restaurant. It's very expensive for Sumatra. The food is average at best. As mentioned we came here from Bukit Lawang which is a small outpost in the jungle. Every dish we had there was far superior to our food here and way cheaper! We sent food back uneaten! To top that my wife and son had bad tummies which we suspect may have been due to eating here! 
-The ride to the airport is expensive at 350000 rupiah one way Although this journey is one hour it's still expensive for the country. This wasn't exactly the handy to the airport hotel I thought it would be! 

To sum up, we spent as much money eating here in one day as we did in 3 elsewhere in Sumatra, had the worst food of our stay, suspect the food for causing stomach upsets and all got badly bitten after staying in a shoddy room! Maybe I got unlucky but I certainly did not have the 5* experience others seem to have enjoyed. If I'm back in Medan I will stay elsewhere
title: What am I missing about this place

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Customer

Thank you for your review. 

Herewith we feel obliged to react:
Hotel Deli River is a small scale eco-friendly family hotel. We have 14 rooms surround by a lush tropical garden. The grounds of the compound of Hotel Deli River consists of 1.2 hectares. Guests have complete walking access throughout the compound, all the way down to the Deli River. 

We pride ourselves in providing the freshest produce possible, from garden to table, we grow pineapples, papaya, banana, nutmeg and other tropical produce. 

Concerning our kitchen, we seldom get complaints about the quality of our meals, on the contrary, people often appreciate our dishes. We are sorry to hear your wife and son had some tummie problems. This could be caused by the  peanut sauce (saus kacang) - which is known to stimulate the digestive process - in the Pecel dish you had. We often have guests who recover in our hotel from tummie problems they got elsewhere. We take hygiene in our kitchen very seriously. Our staff prepare our food with the utmost care. 

We believe our food is reasonably priced. On the one occasion you did dine with us, your total bill consisted of: Pecel vegetable salad with peanut sauce and peanut crackers at Rp. 39.000  (around US$ 2.40) and spring rolls consisting of 2 pieces for  Rp. 30.000 (US$ 2.20). 

Alcoholic beverages however, in comparison to the food is more expensive due to the government tax, which is the case throughout Indonesia. In comparison to the food, the 7X 620mL bottles of beer did raise the total of your bill significantly. 

In relation to the mosquitos, all of the windows in our rooms are fitted with mosquito screens. The additional use of the a/c in your room is also a deterrent. 

Thank you for sharing your findings claiming stains on our walls. Management has checked all of our rooms however were unable to find any. 

We are sorry to hear that you had difficulty with the windows. All our windows are fitted with proper locks. There might have been confusion about the mechanics of the lock. Our staff would have been happy to help and assist you :)  this issue may have also contributed to the mosquitos in your room. 

Concerning the price of the transfer we use normal fares. We pay correct salaries to our drivers as we firmly believe in sustainable tourism. We also only use reliable cars. 

Yes, we are located one hour (45 minutes off-peak) from the airport and our transfers are priced accordingly. At 6:30am, the price for your transfer was increased slightly due to the out of office hours. Transfer price was Rp. 350.000 for 4 pax. 

Most of our guests appreciate our tropical garden, praise our reasonable priced meals, enjoy the well designed comfortable rooms.

The management of Hotel Deli River.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed for 4 days and really enjoyed the green oasis near the traffic jammed city of Medan. The staff is very friendly, the 14 rooms in the garden are very good. Very very good WiFi everywhere. Good restaurant. With the owner Dick we did a jungle run. Very special.
He also knows a lot about the heritage of Medan. We did the special routes along kolonial buildings and the Japannese Camps from worldwar II.
title: Highly recommendable: nature and heritage

text: My visit to one of medan's best hotel is very awesome. With friendly and helpful staffs, deli river hotel does not only provide excellent services but also a magnificient view in countryside medan. The room was very comfy even though it's not luxurious. If you are looking for a place to stay in medan that is far from the busy city atmosphere and provides a peaceful countryside scenery, deli river hotel is definitely the place to stay.
title: Awesome!

text: A spaciously laid-out and well-staffed hotel it served admirably as a half-way house between the opulent shopping areas of Singapore and the near-jungle which is part of Sumatra. The bonus was the advice given on how and where to spend out time from one who has been dealing which such as us for many years.
title: Preparing for inland Sumatra

text:
I would highly recommend Deli River Hotel for those lovely Tourist traveller/ Business traveller who have a Chance to travel to Medan, North Sumatra. Why?
1. an oasis in madness
2. friendly and helpful staff
3. lovely nature surrounds
4. worth for Money though it is not expensive
5. excellent Care of customers

Try it and I am sure your rate will be as high as mine!

Wish you all have an pleasant stay at Deli River Hotel and Restaurant Omlandia!
title: A must-stay hotel

text:
In all my hundreds of trips in every continent except Antarctic I have never seen a staff that work so hard to please the customer.
The owner of the hotel drove me on along to join a 2-hour Hash House Harrier fun run in some of Sumatra’s jungle (the sport originated in Kuala Lumpur, Malaya in late 1930s and has spread around the world, but jungle terrain is best – do it before all of it is chopped down for palm oil plantations).
Very efficient arranging tours in the region.
title: Convenient location, away from pollution, restful, base for day trips and Hash runs.

text:
We received an immediate answer from the Deli River hotel in Medan on our email inquiries for visiting some places I recall from my youth in the North of Sumatra. The programme via Tri Jaya Tour and Travel looked perfect so we decided to come for a few days (were visiting family in Singapore). 
The driver Deddy picked us from the new airport Kualanamu Medan and gave a tour through historic Medan. We liked to have a drink in restaurant Tip Top, still existing! We stayed two nights at Hotel Deli River, at the beginning and end of our short trip to Medan, Brastagi and Prapat.  Very happy with our stay in the beautiful hotel with tropical garden, a reel oasis in busy Medan. The staff were extremely friendly and hospitable. The hotel with his restaurant Omlandia offers good food. Our room was lovely and came fully equipped, the hotel, restaurant, swimming pool were spotlessly clean. The next morning after a excellent breakfast Deddy picked us up for the trip to Brastagi in Karo Hoogland. After a stop in Brastagi we drove to the waterfall Sipisopiso and the Kingshouse Simalungun Batak in Pematang Purba. We went with the ferry to the island Samosir in the lake Toba and stayed in a hotel right on the wonderful and beautiful lake. The next morning after a tour on Samosir we returned with the ferry via Prapat and local (Javanese) restaurant to Medan for dinner and overnight in hotel Deli River. Deddy came the next morning to bring us (very early) to the airport of Medan. Compliments for our excellent driver in a private air-conditioned car and also guide Deddy (speaks different languages, dialects, was punctually, witty). He gave all the for us important information about the different population, culture, nature, showed us several products off the plantations etc. 
We had also interviews with Diana and Dirk, very sympathetic owners of the hotel and the Tri Jaya Tour and Travel. Dirk as historian has given us lots of information about the past! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Deli River and our trip, we only regret the short stay for this beautiful visit to the North of Sumatra! We highly recommend Tri Jaya Tour and Travel for the beautiful and professional trip they has arranged for us!
And recommend hotel Deli River in Medan as the only hotel possible for a stay in Medan/North Sumatra.
title: Excellent stay in Deli River hotel and trip in North Sumatra

text: Deli river is Wonderfull Resort, i have got information from my friends to choose that resort i like that place and my guest also from Holland like too,,but it was surprise for me when i would like to make a room reservation, the Staff name is ELI is very conceited,,and no hospitality at all..please management of deli river teach her how to handle guest and proper way talk to the guest,,and no polite, i am lucky canceled the reservation, i am afraid later on that Eli treated my guest with no hospitality and arrogant
title: Very terrible Associate

owner_response.text:
The story was as follows. Guest Mr. Kembaren came to our hotel at 16.00 and stayed until 18.30.
 Our staff answered his questions and remarks politely and friendly. He wanted to book a certain room and the guest changed his mind and he wanted to book another type of room. Shortly after this, he wanted to book a room for 1 night and after having discussed with his friends he decided to change his stay into  3 nights. We require 30% down payment for this reservation and he agreed to pay with his BCA card.
After this reservation he told to our staff that we have to claim this payment to his guests from Holland when they check in. Our staffs found this strange  since this reservation is done by him and there is a charge from our bank for this payment clearance but the bank charge will be paid by us. Out of a sudden he became very angry and threatened to write negative comments about our service on Tripadvisor. There is no clear reason that he become angry...no reason at all...
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed at the Deli River just for two nights - the first and last nights of our trip in North Sumatra. The staff is charming and welcoming, the rooms are spotlessly clean and nicely setup. In reality, the hotel is at least as good as it looks on the photos!   The hotel arranged our trip from/to the airport and everything went well. Food is very good. The only regret is that the kitchen closes at 9:30 pm (but maybe that was special because this was Ramadhan month).
