One of the best things about this hotel is its peaceful location that comes as a welcome contrast to bustling Medan. Note that it still takes 1h drive to the (new) airport in Kuala Namu - but in fact this is still better than from a hotel down town.
Overall highly recommended.
title: Friendly place

text:
We slept in this hotel the first and last night of our trip in Sumatra last June. It is highly recommended! What a great service, big room with a good bed, nice shower (!), great food, and what a peaceful surrounding in the busy Medan.

The tour we booked through at the hotel connected travel agency Tri Jaya Travel. Again, highly recommended. We did a 7 day trip with private car and driver along Tangkahan, Bukit Lawang (please go rafting! Was a great day was that), Berastagi, Lake Toba and back to Medan. It was a great experience. Everything was organized with perfection. 

We have an unforgettable trip to Sumatra!
title: Unforgettable trip to Sumatra! (Deli River Hotel and Tri Jaya Travel)

text: I was really excited about this hotel but it was nowhere near as good a deal for money as the Grand Aston which was more expensive but soooo much better.  The hotel is Ok, clean with nice gardens, and a great pool.  The beer is not so good but very nicely presented in a wee basket, food was bit weird we got a boiled egg of breakfast one day and we never got what we ordered when we asked for room service.  Fried rice was boiled etc there was a bit of a communication issue but the food itself was not bad. The owners were great and very helpful and the staff tried very hard to be helpful. They arranged a trip to see the orangs which was very good and the driver was the best we had in Indonesia very safe. I would probably not stay here again as the Grand was just so much better but if you don't want to pay millions for a night then this is a good clean hotel with all the services you cold want. This hotel is far away from anything except the river but taxis are cheap.
title: Not that great

owner_response.text:
Dear guests, Thank you very much for your comment. Since we are a small scale eco-friendly family hotel with only 14 rooms we try our best to give personal service to our guests. Our hotel is not comparable to an international chain hotel with a totally different concept such as the Grand Aston. The beer we serve is Bintang Beer which is a tasty Indonesian beer, we serve it cold in a chilled glass. If guests did not get what they ordered for room service there must have been some communication problem, our staff always do their utmost to serve our guests in the best way. We have rooms with twin and double beds, if guests did not get the requested double bed it was not booked by the online booking company. There is a television in each room. We are happy to read that you write so positively about our staff who tried to be helpful and about our driver who was the best you had in Indonesia.

Best Regards,
Management of Hotel Deli River.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Looking at the restaurant from our room

text: The perfect place to get away from the smog, noise and traffic in Medan. The rooms are clean and luxurious compared to other North Sumatra hotels/guest houses (air con and hot water!) and the gardens are lush. Expect to pay more but worth it to be able to escape the heat and chaos for a night.
title: Oasis in Medan

text: I had Juli from the hotel to arrange driver and tranportation to Lake Toba and back.  It was a great trip and my family enjoyed it very much. Our last day in Medan was at this hotel and the children enjoyed a relaxing swim and later had a good dinner in the room. Food was tasty and nice.
title: Re: Top class Treatment

text: We returned to Deli River for the second time because we already appreciated the beauty of it and the very kind and accurate service we experienced the first time. We enjoyed our stay this time for hundred percent again. Assets of Deli River are in particular the green and beautiful environment, the comfortable rooms, the quietness and last but not least the accurate, welcoming and customer friendly approach and attitude by the personnel. We gladly recommend Deli River.
title: Delightful stay

text: We stayed as a family for three days from 18th to 20th April 2014. The palace is an hour drive from the new airport. I had opted for their travels service with a customized tour.The driver Dedy was very helpful and proactive.He made sure we were comfortable the two days he took us on the tour. The hotel is very clean and their food at the restaurant is also very good. They have simple and decent spread for breakfast. The place is very quiet. They give you free Wifi access and the data speed is very good.The owner takes good care of you and makes sure you feel at home.As we had an early flight out of medan, they packed us breakfast box which is very balanced meal. I would recommend you to stay here even if it is out of city limits.
title: Great Place to Stay

text:
Hotel rooms are spacious, very comfortable, great balconies with view over the wonderful ample hotel garden and the green surroundings close to the City, but reflecting a magnificent tropical landscape. Very friendly, welcoming professional services, including great trip assistance.
Excellent facilities on the ground, including nice swimming pool with an enchanting view close to
the hotel restaurant, offering delicious meals and breakfasts.
We had a wonderful, memorable stay here.
title: comfortable, convenient, superb service, beautiful, relaxing hotel

text:
My mother and I only had 3 free nights during our trip to Indonesia. We booked a 2 night stay in Bukit lawing through Trijaya Tour and Travel.

We were picked up by our driver at the airport. This driver had not mastered English yet, but this tour company does employ drivers who can speak English. My mom can speak Indonesian so she was able to communicate with our driver and the trip was a very animated one! At our request the driver took us to a little 'waring' because we really wanted to eat a Sumatran dish called "rendang". We took a bit of a risk eating at a waring on day 1 of our trip to Indonesia, but we enjoyed our food and had no GI upset afterwards.

We stayed at the beautiful Ecolodge Bukit Lawang Cottages. From there it was an easy hike to see the orang utans the next day. What an experience! we saw a mother and baby and later on a juvenile male. Our guide was very knowledgeable and very attentive to my 78 year-old mom for whom the initial part of the hike was quite steep. An extra guide actually came along in case my mom decided she could not continue. We walked through a rubber plantation to get to the reserve. On the way we saw Long-tailed macaque monkeys, Thomas Leaf monkeys. The forest was breathtakingly beautiful (so sad to know that so much of Suamtra's amazing rain forest has been destroyed by palm oil companies--SHAME ON THEM-and the government for letting this happen. 

The ecolodge was an amazing spot: beautiful gardens, lots of information on orang utans and other flora and fauna. The restaurant was very cozy and served delicious indonesian food (we really enjoyed the fried tofu, soups and gado gado)
title: Trijaya Tour and Travel: We thoroughly enjoyed the tour to Bukit Lawang

photos.caption: A very large flower was in bloom on the grounds
comfortable beds and a spacious room
fried tofu, gado gado, sate. Tasty meals every night
Our hotel is right by this river
We had a corner cottage with a wrap around veranda: WONDERFUL

text: we were only on transit in medan and really enjoyed our stay at deli river. i know, it's a bit more expensive but it's all the money worth. the staff is very friendly and the rooms nice and clean...and although it's not the closest to the airport it's worth spending a night there.
title: a relaxing place in a crazy city

text:
The hotel is located on outskirts of Medan which is great (can easily get a cab into town if you want as staff will ring one for you) and has nice gardens in a gully like setting which separates the accommodation from the restaurant/Hotel proper.
Being set down from road helps to reduce noise although did get woken by the dawn call from a mosque. Also has an airconditioner.
Stayed a total of 3 nights here at either end of a tour we arranged and we were very happy with our selection.
Food was good in the Omlandia restaurant and the staff were always helpful and the manager was friendly too. Strange thing for us was that the room had a hairdryer but not a fridge, however no other places we stayed had one either.
fourposter style bed with mosquito net surrounds and room size was ok.
prices whilst higher than elsewhere in Sumatra that we experienced still seemed cheap at start of holiday.
Hotel is about an hour from the new airport or centre of Medan but then the traffic is pretty bad everywhere in Medan with most lane markings or traffic islands seeming to be for decoration rather than splitting up traffic.
Found a few mosquitos here but the hotel provide a local repellant in the restaurant and we ended up buying and using the same as it smelt and went in so much better than the bushmans we took with us.
Happy to recommend this hotel
title: Nice and quiet but not in centre of city.

text: Hotel Deli River has a beautiful trankil setting quite far from the center of Medan. When I was staying there, there was some noise during the daytime from the construction of an additional building on the premises which took away a bit of the piecefull atmosphere. The room I stayed in was clean, but pretty basic, with two single beds (though I had asked for a queen sized bed) and a very tiny tv. The staff were friendly and the food served in the restaurant was nice, but the restaurant appeared a bit on the pricy side for a Medan restaurant. All in all I found my stay in Deli River OK, but both room and restaurant seemed a bit overpriced (European prices) compared to what else you can find in Medan.
title: A bit overpriced

owner_response.text: Thank you for your comment. Regarding the construction, we would like to inform you on the fact that the construction of the new rooms was finished in July 2013. Concerning the price of meals we give the following example: a nasi goreng in our restaurant costs Rp. 54.000 in Indonesian rupiah equivalent to US$ 4.5. This consists of nasi goreng with omelete, three sticks sate, salad and kerupuk, which is not overpriced. About our rooms, they are very comfortable as you can read in other guestcomments. They are beautifully set in a tropical garden with view to the fish pond surrounded by fruit trees like mangosteen, rambutan, mango and guava. We have more than 16 varieties of birds and butterflies  in our garden. The management of hotel Deli River
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Our first day in Sumatra. We needed a place, to reset minds and relax, as a slow start for 1 week in Sumatra and three weeks in Asia.  Perfect start.
Ok Food. Nice swimmingpool. Det location is outside city centre. For us it didnt matter, but should be mentioned.
title: Very nice place

text: I have an eco- tour business where we need to provide our guests with a quality hotel, good service and delicious food. The Deli River delivers on all of these along with friendly personalised service and immaculately clean rooms. The location is excellent and provides a very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Diana and her team are doing an excellent job and thoroughly recommend their hotel to anyone travelling to Medan.
title: Deli River Hotel Medan

text:
We loved our stay at this hotel. It's a quiet place just 20 minutes from downtown Medan. The food is good, at breakfast they had home-made cake and pineapple jam. When we had an early check out, they gave us a breakfastbox to take with us! The rooms are big and clean,no refrigerator but you can use the one in the restaurant. The swimmingpool is lovely with an amazing view.
We arranged our trip to Lake Toba and Brestagi also at their travel agency, Trijaya travel. If you want to know about the history of Medan, just ask the owner, he would love to tell you about it.
When I go back to Medan, I would stay here again.
title: A little paradise.

text: We started a 16 day tour of northern Sumatra with 2 nights at deli river hotel. The room was very nice with hot water, WiFi and air con. The restaurant was good by Sumatran standards, but I would not recommend buying wine - its too difficult to ensure reasonable quality and the price is high, especially if its 'off'. Breakfast was excellent, but if you're working to a schedule allow plenty of time as things can be a bit slow. All in all, a good place to stay - probably much better than options in Medan.
title: very happy with deli river

text:
We started our Sumatra trip in this dutch-run venue with a nice airport pick-up. A very clean and comfortable room and quiet with nice and helpful staff.
Better than we expected when booking in advance.

Niels & Sylvia
title: Very nice and beyond the obvious

text: Fantastic oasis in Medan really friendly staff and owners, excellent food, best breakfast of our 12 days in Indonesia. Lovely swimming pool and gardens. Just what we needed after our jungle adventure.
title: Paradise after the jungle

text: Stayed here for one night prior to leaving for airport.  THe rooms are really lovely, all very modern and recently refurbished with good bathrooms. The staff are attentive and polite. However, the restaurant is a complete let down - we had dinner there - we ordered steaks but two of us had  steaks that were rancid which we sent back - the staff's attitude was a little non comital - we then ordered the more expensive T bone steaks which the others had ordered as they had nothing else but were still charged the full price.  We ordered wine which was on the menu as dry French white wine but was nothing of the sort...Again, when we sent it back, we were told they had stopped stocking french wine because no one bought it and so had substituted for a cheap local alternative.  I think the problem was that they just don't know how to cook western style food and we should have known better than to order it - although the majority of the clientele that night were western.  We all had tummy upsets the following day.
title: Great rooms

text: I had a wonderful stay at this lovely, family-run inn and restaurant.  The owners and staff are so courteous and kind, and are clearly committed to prompt and classy service.  Going to see the amazingly-kept grounds is worth the trip alone.  The restaurant is also first-class, with very tasty Indonesian and Chinese-inspired dishes, but also a solid Western-inspired menu.  One night, I was craving a steak and the chef did not disappoint!  Visiting Medan from anywhere, especially abroad, and not staying here would be a serious mistake!
title: Wonderful Oasis in the Medan Area

text:
At the end of a long journey we arrived at Hotel Deli River. What a beautiful place to stay! Nice rooms, excellent food for a good price, a restaurant where you want to stay the whole day because it is beautiful and cool. The staff is friendly and helpfull. 
We will recommend this place to everyone who wants to go to Sumatra!
title: The ideal place to start your Sumatra trip.

text:
I stayed in the deli river hotel with my girlfriend around mid august.
u actually cant say anything about the rooms and the internet is alright. (everything is rather pricy)

however, when it comes to service, it cries SCAM!
we asked Ms. Julie (staff from the hotel) to make a phone call to a bus company.
But she only would do it if we d pay for the phone call,,,,

it already started to smell fishy, thats why i timed the phone call.
after 2 min and 20 seconds she wanted to be paid for 10 min which apparently equals 10.000 rupiah... well...

Furthermore the information she provided did not answer even one of our questions!

It seems that all she wanted is to charge and sell stuff where she can earn commission.

to sum up: location is alright but the service is very poor for the price u pay!

so: if some named julie wants the help you out in the deli river... check everything twice
title: blood suckers!

owner_response.text:
In relation to the above comment we feel obliged to react. Guests do not pay Rp. 10.000 (0,90 cent in USD) but only Rp. 2.500  (0,22 cent in USD).  The chronology was the following: Guests asked information about transport and requested Ms. Juli to call a transport company for prices. After Ms. Juli had called the company she asked clients to talk directly to the company. But guests refused to talk because of the language barrier. Guests wanted to know the price of a chartered car after which Juli translated the price. This was all that happened, there were no other intentions and nothing about commission.  Management Hotel Deli River. 
 ===
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My family of four stayed here for 1 night as a stop over on our trip through Sumatra. This place was so much better then the Grand Swiss Bell. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, and the service wonderful. It was a great place to stay with children; there is a flying fox. playground and attractive pool area. This hotel has real character and it is the only place I would stay if I return to Medan in the future
title: I love this place

text:
We stayed at this tranquil oasis twice during our trip to Sumatra – once after our late arrival flight into Medan, and again prior to an early flight to Banda Aceh. It is a beautiful retreat away from the noise and busyness of Medan.

We stayed in a different room on each occasion – firstly an upper level twin room, and later a lower level double room.
Both rooms were comfortable, with good beds, tea and coffee making facilities, a TV (CNN being the only English speaking channel), air conditioning (both very quiet AND effective) and a clean bathroom. The second room had a bath and shower, the first only a shower. Wifi is generally available, but this wasn’t working on our first visit, worked perfectly the second time around.

The call to prayer early in the morning felt exceptionally loud, and we could hear children singing from a location nearby at breakfast. Also the hotel is beneath the flight path to and from the airport, which didn’t really change when the airport moved to Kuala Namu (which it had by our second visit). Pick up from the airport is free of charge, and drop off at Kuala Namu cost us 190,000 Rp. It can take more than an hour to get to the new airport, but early in the morning (we left at 6.30am) it took us only 45 mins.

The rooms are in buildings on one side of the property, with a pretty pond separating it from the grand main building (with a towering Batak type roof) where the reception and restaurant "Omlandia" are situated. We ate in the restaurant only on our second visit – the food was good, but pricey compared to the rest of Sumatra in our opinion. But their Dutch Apple pie was really good! Breakfast was fruit, toast and a hard boiled egg, served with juice and tea/coffee. For our early morning departure to the airport, a packed breakfast was provided.

Behind the main building is a swimming pool, with surprisingly warm water, which overlooks the river and surrounding countryside. There are a limited number of sun loungers and chairs surrounding the pool. Items can be ordered from the restaurant for delivery to poolside.
The staff generally speak English quite well, and are very friendly and polite.

All in all this was an excellent place to stay, and I’d recommend it to anyone needing to spend a night in Medan.
title: Peaceful oasis

text:
A very nice place to stay: a haven of peace in the middle of busy Medan. Staying there feels like you are far, far away from the city. 
The rooms are good and clean. Airconditioning works well. Supplimentaries such as coffee, tea and bottles of  water (definitively no tap water!!) are present. 
The swimming pool is nice and offers a panoramic view over de garden below. Though some extra sun beds would have been welcome.

The restaurant is situated on a higher part of the compound and has an open structure, allowing a cooling wind coming through. The menu is fine, including Dutch specialities as 'poffertjes', 'bitter ballen' and apple pie (very good).
Service is of more than average quality, most people speak English well and are very helpful. 

This is an excellent place to stay to get used to the climate (for new comers) or to relax from a trip to the jungle. If you are interested in the Dutch history of Medan (tabacco and rubber plantations) or Dutch architecture contact the owner. He has some short trips available showing you the highlights of the city.
title: A very nice place to stay

text:
Deli River hotel is situated in a beautiful garden with a big swimmingpool.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable.  The staff is very kindly and helpfull. 
The food in Omlandia restaurant is excellent.
We really enjoyed our stay in Deli River.  We hope that  once we can go back to hotel Deli River to stay there again !!!
title: A nice place to stay ...

text: Excellent facilities, great pool and relaxing grounds. Clean and comfortable we really appreciated the calm before our trek in the jungle.  The kids enjoyed swimming in the pool overlooking the river. Really had the impression of a jungle location despite being under the flightpath. The calls to prayer and the overhead jets reminded us that we were in a major city  but the ambiance was  otherwise.
title: great palce to relax

text: Deli river is a great spot to relax a bit after a long flight. It is quite far from the centre, but is quiet (except for a couple of mosques) and has a great pool, with kids area. Staff are very nice - not everyone speaks English, but they try their best and help out with everything they can. Food at the Omlandia is excellent and they provided lots of little extra bits and pieces for our toddler at no aditional cost. I specifically would like to mention the great Judy, who managed to not just book us on all kinds of flights, but helped out in a fantastic way when our daughter needed to go to a hospital.
title: Good service, great food

text: Very clean rooms, bathroom is good and the shower is hot. AC is working, but it is still warm. Free wifi, the Restaurant is nice and the food is tasty. Lots of mosquits, but they give you repellent. A little noisy because it's close to the airport. Very nice Pool. We would stay there again.
title: Very good hotel in Medan

text:
Hotel 'Deli River' is the perfect place to recover from the long continental flight, and to get used to the tropical heat. After we were picked up from the airport, we crossed Medan trough heavy  and hectic traffic before we reached the hotel, just outside the city center. It's unbelievable what a great job they had done creating such a comfortable, quiet place on that spot. Rooms with view on the gorgeous tropical garden were really comfortable. We indulged in the freshly made fruit juices and cold Bintang lager sitting on the edge of the swimming pool with view on River Deli, and really enjoyed the extended breakfast and lovely Indonesian food on the terrace. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and very motivated to make it a pleasant stay.

Our mission on our journey to Sumatra was "Nostalgia Belanda", a quest for our family's roots. Ever since the moment we arrived at the Medan airport, Triyaya tours, related to the Deli River Hotel, put an enormous effort in making it a carefree and beautiful 14-day travel from Medan to Padang for us. In advance we discussed our wishes for our journey with Triyaya tours. Because of their knowledge about the history of the colonial era, as well as their obvious experience as a tour operator, they were well suited to give helpful advise regarding the content of our journey. It turned out to be a journey consisting of a pleasant combination of sight seeing, hikes and mooches, and rest days. Our tour guide/driver Yul made the trip even more unforgettable, driving us around not only safely, but also with so much care and being so involved with us, not to mention his great sense of humor. He relentlessly tried to find every place or building we wanted to see. We warmly recommend the Deli River Hotel and Triyaya Tours to anyone who considers traveling around on Sumatra.
Janneke R
title: Hotel Deli River the perfect place to be

text: Hotel Deli River is expanding from six to 14 rooms, so there was some low-key construction going on, but it was nearing the finishing stage. If you're looking for a quiet place a world away from noisy, busy Medan, coming into this guesthouse is the right choice. The restaurant serves freshly-prepared high-quality food, with some outstanding Javanese dishes, and the included breakfast is very nice. Rooms have a colonial feel, and are very comfortable, and the staff and owners make sure you get lots of personal attention. We'll be back.
title: Still Good, and Expanding

text:
A short stay in Sumatra to see the roots of my wife. A lot has been changed since 1958. The trip was perfectly arranged by Trijaja Tours & Travel. And above all a fantastic driver (Juwl). We started in Medan (Deli River Hotel – 3 nights). Went via Tuk-Tuk on the Samosir Island (Tabo Cottages – 3 nights) en Betastagi (Grand Mutiari – 1 night) back to the Deli River Hotel again (3 nights). Aspecially the Deli River was a fantastic hotel. An oasis in the middle of a hectic Medan. Nice staff en very good service. Recommendable!!
I read the comments of other guests and almost everyone had the same experience as we had and gave the maximum appreciation. Except for one guest that had – we think – an off-day when he wrote his findings in this site.

Dick & Emy van Lochem-van Walsum, april 2013.
title: An Oasis in Medan

text:
We decided to stay at Deli River on the final night of our adventurous family holiday with three young children in Sumatra for a relaxing evening prior to 25hours of travel home the following day. We were told a driver would be waiting for us at the arrivals terminal to meet our internal flight from Banda Aceh. After waiting for twenty minutes we rang the hotel where we told there had been a delay and the driver would be with us in fifteen minutes. Forty minutes later, and an hour after promised, the vehicle finally arrived, with no explanation or apology, despite our young children having to endure constant cigarette smoke on the airport concourse.
We complained to the staff on arrival who looked surprised. Eventually a middle-aged European woman [we presume she was the manager although didn't introduce herself] appeared and blamed a previous customer, even though alternative transport could easily have been arranged by the hotel.  Our children were by now too tired to eat their meal. A European man appeared [possibly the owner - again, he didn't introduce himself] and blamed the transport department of the hotel.  To add insult to injury his compensation package involved knocking 20% off the price of the uneaten meals!
In summary, left waiting at the airport for an hour with senior staff who didn't seem to care and offered insulting recompense.
title: left waiting at airport for an hour

text:
This is an ideal place to rest after or before a sightseeing trip around Sumatra, as it is south of Medan  is an ideal stopover forLake Toba.
Probably most travellers will agree one day in Medan to look at the sites  is enough which can be arranged from the Deli River which is only 40 minutes away from your room  which you could well imagine the resort is  actually in the rain forest 
The resort as a discreet play area for children, paddling pool, within an excellent swimming pool
title: Chill out

text:
Firstly don't confuse my overall rating with level of enjoyment - we enjoyed this place very much. However it is said that greatness is acheived through attention to detail and that is where the Deli River could brush up a little. Although the room was cleaned well enough the bed linen and towels are extremely old and thin and in need of renewing.

The staff were all pleasant enough, however I must mention Ellie (sorry if that's not the correct spelling) who was by far the most communicative, helpful and friendly. I was disappointed though that much is said about the owners of whom it is said wax lyrical about local history and traditions to their guests but were obviously too preoccupied to have made themselves known to us for the entire three days. Shame because that's a quality I enjoy when travelling.

That said, I think we were well looked after with good local food and the terrace at the dining room was a pleasant spot to enjoy a couple of cold pre-dinner beers at reasonable prices. I can't comment on Western food, it's not what we go to Indonesia to eat.

We took a trip from the hotel with their driver (Suriya - once again forgive the spelling if it's wrong) who was a friendly and interesting lad and he gave us a full day out with a good tour of the local area. To anyone who wants a memory to treasure go for the tour to Supiso-Piso Waterfall, impessive by itself after a short walk down the hillside, but the first view you get over the beautiful Lake Toba will stay with us for a very long time.

I also liked a walk out from the hotel as along the road there are a few stalls and eating places and I thought a generally affable place, even a small supermarket (outside, turn right and about 3-5 mins walk) for a few lunchtime provisions or a can or two of chilled beer. The local people mainly wanted to say hello and no-one hassled to sell us anything.

When we left it was unfortunately at the ungodly hour of 5.30 in the morning to catch an early flight but the staff gave us an apetising breakfast in a box the night before without us even asking and Suriya was there bang on time to take us to the airport.

Overall I would rate Sumatra as one of the more pleasant Indonesian places we have visited and one to which, one day, we would gladly return. Would we stay at the Deli River again? Well yes we probably would.
title: Well it went quickly - so we must have enjoyed it....

text:
We enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms are fine and the grounds and pool are well maintained. The staff are all very helpfull and the owners will offer advice if asked. The pickup and transfer from the heaving masses of Medan Airport was spot on. There is wifi in the room and in the restaurant.

The restaurant always features fresh cooking and the prices are reasonable for Medan. It caters for both local and European food and having had 6 lunches and 6 dinners we did not run out of options. We like our toast done quite well. Having asked once it was always served just as we like it. We were pleasantly surprised by our final restaurant and laundry bill. 

A small fly in the ointment was the inability to pay by UK credit card. The problem lies in the restaurant/reception somewhere. We called our bank to make sure that we were not at fault.

We would definitely stay here again on a future trip.

Ps Make sure you also have a meal at Tip Top restaurant in Medan and take your camera.
title: A nice place to stay

text:
Hotel Deli River is a refreshing break from the monotony of staying in a chain Hotel.

Owner run , with friendly staff, good food , comfortable rooms .

The hotel is situated about 30 minutes drive from the airport in a rural and undeveloped area.

The accommodation comprises 8 rooms in two double story cottages separated from the main dining area by a pond .

Each of the cottage rooms having their own balcony .

They are spotlessly clean , with very comfortable beds , sitting area , air con , TV (only one English language News Channel )..but you are not here to watch TV!!

Bathroom is simply appointed with all the standard amenities.

Dirk and Diana obviously treat their staff as family , some staff have very little English but are all very helpful.

Breakfast was included in the room rate .

Good local coffee/tea ..cereal/fruits/toast and eggs are served along with fresh fruit juice . Plenty to keep you full till lunch time.

Wine is VERY expensive in Indonesia ..be prepared to pay over 25GBP for a drinkable bottle.

Beer is reasonable and good.

Local and Western dishes were prepared to order and of good quality and taste.
title: Character Hotel in rural area outside Medan

photos.caption: View from dining room towards swimming pool
Bedroom area of ground floor twin bedded cottage

text: hotel deli river is  on pleasant grounds, but far from the city of Medan and quite difficult to get into the city.  Booked a tour with Trijaya, they were helpful in booking domestic flights which was a plus.  However,once in Sumatra our experiences with the tour company was disappointing.  First our driver provided by the company was  aloof, spoke no English and did not assist with luggage. It was also quite frustrating most of the time because there was little communication. Once we arrived at our first destination the elephant reserve, the lodge had no idea we were arriving and had to make adjustments. We met other guests at the lodges that were from other tours and the service they received was far more superior to the service we receive from Trijaya. Despite our frustrations, we found the elephant and orangutan reserves lovely and the staff and guides in both of these locations fantastic.
title: trijaya tours and hotel deli river disappointing

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your feedback. Your complaint has been duly noted and we will try to resolve this communication problem of our driver. We had booked your room at the elephant centre otherwise you would not have got a room. This is because you were there during the peak season Christmas holiday.We are happy that you were satisfied with the local guides that we had arranged for you. Concerning hotel Deli River, as we are an eco-friendly family hotel we have chosen a location in the midst of the Sumatran jungle. This implicates that we are not located nearby the town centre. Thank you very much for your constructive comments.
Regards, 
Management of Hotel Deli River and Tri Jaya Tour and Travel
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
There is two buildings, a restaurant and a lovely swimming pool. tucked away in the green there is an amazing view. The bedroom are very comfortable, bathrooms very clean and well maintained. The swimming pool is clean and pleasant, the service is very good. The food is pretty average but the breakfast is fantastic with lots of local jam and fruits. I would definitely recommend this place for a quiet and comfortable night away from dusty and noisy Medan. 
This hotel is also the departure point of all Trijaya tours that I would recommend.
title: an oasis near Medan

text:
The owners of this hotel made our trip back to Indonesia a great experience. Travelling with my sister to the country where our parents and we ourselves were born was a first time experience for me. As we wanted to visit all the places where we had lived this was quite a search after 50 years! But our driver Erwin was absolutely fantastic- he drove us everywhere, finding all the rubber estates, which sometimes took hours to get to. Of all the houses we had lived in sadly only one we found still there. But what an incredible feeling it was to run into the garden and feel that you had come home! And to go and have an ice cream in Tip Top just like in the old days. And visiting Lake Toba where we used to go to on vacation as children. 
I want to thank our driver and the owners of Hotel Deli River for making all this possible. It was an unforgettable experience.
And oh yes, the Indonesian food at the Deli River is fantastic and absolutely authentic , just as we remember it.
title: Everything was perfect

text: Hotel Deli River and Omlandia Restaurant is a wonderful relaxing place to spend your time when in Sumatra. The staff are all very sweet and kind and will go out of their way to make your stay unforgettable and thoroughly enjoyable.  Out of the hustle and bustle of Medan city - you find this place between the trees in a tropical garden. Eating, drinking, to relax in, this place has everything travellers need. The rooms are comfortable, and as clean as could possibly be. I would recommend Hotel Deli River to any who travel need Medan. From Hotel Deli River you can organise your next tour, trip or adventure. Just relaxing by the magnificent pool was enough for me to not want to return home very soon.
title: Hidden Treasure

text:
This place is great.
Value for money... Could be better, since the price of for example the swiss Bell hotel isn't that far of.
But, cottages are great with relaxing views over the huge pont and outside busy Medan.
The owners and staff are very helpfull and knowledgable about Sumatra.
They also run a tourist office and are able to book your trip to your needs and wishes.

At the Same time that is what we found to be the only downside.
We booked a five day trip with them, and all was taken care of ... Well.
Although... We recommend you to try and be adventurous... book everything yourself.
A car and driver can be found easily, hotels and guides also.
You pay less and most importantly the locals get more money as they would trought travel agencies.

Foodwise, this place offers lokal and Western food prapared in Western style kitchen ;-)

Tip: Medan is nicer than most people discribe. 
First time Asia travelers will find that this city is too busy and dirty, but people are friendly and just want to know about you and were you come from.
Medan has few tourist sites.

Taxi back to the hotel... Get a Becak. Hotels will overcharge you and again the driver gets just a little share.

The Deli river hotel is a great choice if you don't mind a 20 minute drive to downtown city Medan.
title: City escape

text:
We went to Medan for only one purpose: Lake Toba. Hence, we went straight to Lake Toba on the day we arrived. However, we did stay at Medan on our last day. 
The hectic traffic in Medan is driving me crazy. I am so glad that after our 3D2N peaceful trip at Samosir Island, we stayed at Hotel Deli River instead of any other hotels at the city center. We decided to spend our last day enjoying this hotel :)
It sits at a peaceful village. You can hear birds chipping and roosters crowing at the break of dawn. 
All the hotel rooms facing a lovely pond. Our room is very clean and comfortable. It is very cozy sitting at the balcony, with the view of pond and lovely garden. 
I love their restaurant. The food served are real good! You really have to try their juicy sate :)We had continental breakfast the next morning. Our table is setup nicely near the pond. The breakfast came with local fruits, fresh fruit juice, eggs, toast, cheese, jam etc. We had great time chit chat over the breakfast table. 
Oh, and I love the swimming pool too. It made me feel like swimming at a private pool :)  

However, for those that wish to see Medan city, this hotel may not be suitable. It is a bit far off from city of Medan and the airport (It cost us 80,000 rupiah to travel from hotel to airport by taxi). Worse is, not many taxi drivers in Medan actually heard of this hotel before. We had trouble getting to the hotel on the night we came back from Lake Toba because the taxi driver didn't know the way and he had to drive us to his office to check with other drivers. None of them heard of this hotel before, they were guided by the hotel workers through phone.
title: Only For Those that Wish To Hide Away from the Crowd

text: This is a great hotel to stay in if you want to arrive in North Sumatra and by-pass the city of Medan to go on to Lake Toba.  You need to know it is quite a long way from the city of Medan and the Airport (you have to pay 90,000 rupiahs by taxi) and once there it takes time to get a taxi if you want to go in to Medan.  But, it is a lovely place with a very good restaurant (people come from all over to eat there) and a very nice owner-operator,Ibu Diana.  The rooms are comfortable and the environment very nice, with gardens overlooking a pond. Ibu Diana can arrange a very good car and driver to take you to Lake Toba or other places.
title: Nice family-run hotel but off beaten track

text: We stayed with friends and our two kids (10 and 7) at the Hotel Deli River on our arrival and departure (four nights in total).  The rooms had inter-connectig doors and were perfectly comfortable.  We enjoyed some of the best food we ate in Sumatra at the restaurant and enjoyed conversations with the friendly staff and owners.  Our children loved the pool, the flying fox and the beautiful plants and flowers in the lovely garden.  We all enjoyed our trips to and from Medan in a becak.
title: Something for all the family at Deli River

photos.caption: A section of the dining room with beautiful high ceilings and lights
View from the balcony towards the dining room/restaurant
Lovely, large pool with a view to the Deli River below

text:
We booked this hotel based on its excellent reviews. We came in during a violent thunderstorm after a long day's journey from Lake Toba, and were a little surprised at the isolated setting and grassy driveway and deserted parking lot. However, it soon became apparent that we were in good hands.

The staff consists of several very bright university coeds apparently associated with the Omlandia Student Society. They showed a combination of easy competence and friendliness that had us settled comfortably sipping a cool beverage with supper ordered and arrangements made for airport transport next day within ten minutes of arrival.

The food was exceptionally good. We ordered Javanese dishes, and the size of the portions and elegance of the presentation matched the brilliant use of spices. Our included continental breakfast the next morning featured fruit, fruit juice, eggs, toast, cheese, jam, and a pot of very good coffee, so we headed to the airport in good trim.

Our room was in a building across the fish pond from the restaurant. It had both fan and AC, cable TV, good lighting, and reliable hot water. We slept well in the comfortable beds until and after the call to prayer, with no other sound to disturb our rest. Try that in downtown Medan!

Our hotel-arranged transportation was there early, and despite the heavy 0800 traffic, he got us to the airport in a half hour, so unless you have shopping or business to do in noisy, dirty Medan, staying in this quiet area doesn't add much time to your airport commute.

This is a good hotel that is different from anywhere else we've ever stayed in Indonesia. If we're in Medan again, it will be our first choice.
title: A Unique Spot

text: The hotel is awesome and eco-friendly. Service is friendly.
title: Awesome

text: There were six of us - four adults and two children - who arrived late one evening after a long trip from Australia. We were met at the airport as arranged and when we got to the Deli River there was no fuss - staff showed us to our rooms (with check-in left to the next morning). Lovely. Our rooms were very comfortable, clean, the bedding and towels perfectly fine. With efficient and welcome air-conditioning.  The next morning the breakfast table was set on the garden terrace and proved to be the first of a number of excellent meals.  Its true that the Deli is out of town,  in a flight path, and the call to prayer can be heard. But we all agreed these were both minor, and in some ways welcome - the call to prayer especially was not a static riven yell but rather beautiful, and as for the flight path we have stayed in Sanur Bali - now there is a flight path! All in all a great choice we returned there after our Aceh trip and were made welcome.  I have to add that for children (and adults) the pool is a joy beautiflly clean perfect - and last of all the flying fox! The children almost refused to leave. Deanna and Dirk and their staff provide a perfect haven from which to explore the wonders that are Sumatra!
title: A Gem

text: I loved everything except for the slippers inside my room.
title: Spectacular

text:
There were 6 families in our group (13 adults, 10 children) when we visited Medan. We occupied 6 out of 8 rooms available at this hotel. We just put up a night here. Its quite a distance from town, so if you plan to go shopping at Pasar Ikan, I would not recommend you to stay here. With the heavy traffic and the narrow roads, it can easily take 45 minutes to get to town.

We stayed here because shopping was not our main itinerary. We needed a place to unwind after a tiring journey from Brastagi. 

Basic rooms but clean and spacious. Every room has a balcony. The kids loved the swimming pool and the flying fox. Not many activities here so if you need that adrenaline rush, dont stay here. Good internet connection.

Food - nothing to shout about but the fried rice for breakfast was good. We tried poffertjes and loved it. Coffee making facilities, tv are available in every room.

We were not satisfied with the minibus Tri Jaya provided. The minibus could only accomodate 24 people. There were already a driver, a tour guide and a co-driver in the minibus. The minibus was so small, it was so difficult to move around in the minibus. There was 1 kind of smell in the minibus, aircond very noisy, faulty brakes. Blessing in disguise when the minibus broke down on the way from Brastagi to Medan, they replaced with a new and bigger bus.

The tour guide did ask for tips after the tour ended, if I am not mistaken Rp350,000. If you want to buy Bika Ambon, you can do so at the airport, no need to order from the tour guide as the price is cheaper at the airport.

Overall, Tri Jaya did a good job, would definitely recommend friends to book with them.
title: Home Away From Home

text:
Lovely garden, river, pool, duck pond.
Large airy comfortable rooms.
Friendly staff. Restaurant food good.
Occasional noise from aircraft, mosque.
title: comfortable

text: We began and ended our week-long stay with Tri Jaya tours by staying at Hotel Deli River. The setting was lovely, the pool was wonderful, the rooms were clean and well organised, and the staff were absolutely delightful. Free WiFi was good, and the restaurant was excellent (which was lucky, since it's the only restaurant accessible on foot!). All services offered were as promised. We were very happy with our stay and would definitely stay again.
title: Lovely stay

text:
My wife and I visited the hotel in November and we have nothing, but good to say about the hotel and the service.  The hotel is a lovely haven of peace in comparison to the hectic city outside. The rooms were bright and clean, the restaurant served delicious Dutch and Indonesian food, breakfast was served overlooking the duck pond, the perfect way to start the day. There was also the added advantage of the swimming pool, perfect after a trip into the jungle! We found the staff to be very polite and helpful and English was spoken.  Yes, we did hear the Call to Prayer at 5am, but this is Indonesia and it confirmed we were in an exotic land..and not back home in an English winter.
We also booked with Trijaya Tours and I would highly recommend their tours. Our driver (Welly) was excellent, good english, great sense of humour and we felt very safe on the roads at all times. We did 2 trips, Bukit Lawang and Lake Toba staying the Deli River before, in-between and after the tours which allowed us to relax a little.  Sumatra is an adventure and the Hotel deli River offers a nice bit of luxury and their tour company offers tours to suit your length of stay with your driver and own vehicle.
Thanks too for Diana and Dirk who were often on hand to ask about our tours and offer advice.

We hope to stay again.
Martin and Sue

PS If anyone has Welly as their driver on the Lake toba tour, please feel free to mention the Loch Ness Monster at some stage. He will enjoy it.
title: We loved our stay at the Deli River

text:
My wife and I stayed a couple of days in Hotel Deli River before starting our nostalgic trip to Padang. Deli River is a high standard, pretty, beautifully situated, colonial style hotel, providing excellent services. It is a pleasant spot to recover from all travel stress before getting on wheels again.

As I was born in North Sumatra before WW-2 and never returned to this area, this trip intended to  put faces to names, such as Pangkalan Brandan (my place of birth), Brastagi, Prapat, Lake Toba, etc. 
Who else better that Dirk Buiskool, historian and owner of the hotel, could act as sounding board and reliable source of information.
A two day trip to the Orangutan reserve in Bukit Lawang was an exciting and interesting addition to all nostalgic considerations and experiences

The tour itself, organized by Tri Jaya Travel, also managed and owned by Dirk Buiskool and his wife Diana, was a great success and fully met our touristic and nostalgic expectations.
Timing of distances (no driving after sunset), excursions, hotels and our personal wishes were well considered. We got a high standard car and our driver, Youl, contributed highly to this enjoyable trip, not just by his safe driving (as traffic can be quite erratic), but also by his pleasant company and good advice.

We can highly recommend services of both Hotel Deli River and Tri Jaya Travel
title: Back to the roots

text:
I stayed at Hotel Deli River from April 25 - 30 and May 3 - 5, 2011. My trip to Sumatra was mostly about digging into my mother's family history. The fact that hotel owner Dirk Buiskool is a Dutch historian with extensive knowledge of Medan's colonial past certainly helped me in chosing this hotel but it was especially the favourable reviews on this website. 
And I was not disappointed! 
The beautiful garden is a feast for the eye as well as the spirit. The rooms are charming and clean. The staff are friendly and efficient. Unlike some reviewers I thought the food was excellent but I only had the Indonesian / Chinese dishes. Frankly, I don't understand the logic behind eating European food when travelling in Asia. Try Deli River's egg roll and you will be hooked for life!
You can describe every single aspect of this hotel and judge it, but for me it all comes down to one thing: atmosphere. The owners have managed to create a combination of professionalism and homeliness. Quite unique in my view. Hotel Deli River is a home away from home.
title: Hotel Deli River: home away from home

photos.caption: The pond with palm trees and the cottages in the background

text:
As other reviews already stated: The hotel is a beautiful estate in maybe the most beautiful place you could find in Medan: In the outskirts of the city, some 5km south of the airport, built on a hill at the shore of Deli river (as the name suggests). It is a very beautiful hide-away, especially for families with smaller children: there is a small playground, a beautiful pool-side and some (well-walled) terrain to explore. Nothing of this you would find in the city hotels; and if you stay in Medan only coming from or going to the airport, it may be a good choice. But there are quite a few "but"s. First: For a hotel aimed mostly at European guests, the cuisine is sub-standard. We had a really aweful Cordon Bleu and an even more aweful NZ tenderloin steak. The Indonesian food they serve, is better, but the Western style meals are not worth the money. Second: The place is beautiful, but the rooms are not quite as good as you can get for the same money in, say, the Swiss-Belhotel or the Grand Aston. Not to be misunderstood: The rooms are o.k. (AC, TV, clean, nice and good furniture, en-suite-bathrooms ...), but they are not 5-star, 3+ at the best. Especially the bathrooms could need an upgrade soon. Third: If your travel plans include a visit of Medan city (which can be quite interesting if you know where to look), you need between 45-75 minutes to get there - one way! 4th: Unlike you might expect, the noise level is HIGHER than in any 5-star-city hotel! Why? The hotel is located directly in the approach path of Medan airport, so you have 4 or 5 planes per hour going directly over your head during daytime. Fortunately, there are no nightly take-offs. And: There is a mosque directly at the other side of the river - which can be very annoying, esp. at 4 o'clock in the morning. If you stay in one of the upper floors of one of the city hotels, you have much better isolated rooms high above the city's noise level.
The service is good, as you could expect in that class of hotel: Well trained and very friendly staff (which is already something for Indonesia!).

Our experience is quite mixed, and our recommendation is not without some limitations. If you know what to look for and what you can expect, it is ok.
title: maybe the best spot in Medan - but ...!

text:
We stayed at Deli River before and after our tour to Lake Toba.
The hotel was just right and with airport pick up made it perfect.
Food was good and will return here when we are back in Sumatra.
title: Perfect Stay

text:
Hotel Deli River is in very pleasant grounds. The pool looked very inviting but didn't try it. It is out of town and away from all the traffic but it is also on the main flight path! The free internet is a nice touch but the rooms are expensive for what you get. We booked a triple room for the night. In my e-mail correspondance I was assured there was three separate beds as we were 3 friends travelling together. When shown out room one bed was a matress on the floor. Having said that the rooms were very clean, with pleasing decor. However, there was no firdge in the room and no tea or coffee making facilities and even at a reduced rate of 98 USD I think this is too expensive for sumartra. 
The resturant they boast about serves over priced very average food. Drinks are also expensive and as you have no fridge, and no tea or coffee facilities in your room or anywhere to buy things you have to get them from the hotel. Breakfast was included in the price and the fresh toasted bread with jams and some cheese was really lovely, we were given hard boiled eggs (a choice of how you wanted your eggs would be nice) plus fresh tea or coffee.

Hotel staff tried hard to answer my questions but had very little english. The owners, who I think were dutch, were nowhere to be seen. This hotel could be really good if it added a few more touches or charged a bit less!
title: disappointed

text: If you are tired of standard corporate hotel rooms; if you appreciate personalized service; if are interested in excursions in northern Sumatra; if you want to know more about  the historic connection with the Dutch (one of the proprietors is a historian); if you are curious about tropical plants and gardens and if you are not afraid to be exposed to the tropics and daily life in Medan, then Hotel Deli River is the right choice. The restaurant (Omlandia) offers good Indonesian and European food and the recently built swimming pool provided cool relaxation after our regular excursions.
title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

text: I loved this place.  Beautiful grounds, lovely architecture, friendly hosts (Diana and Dirk) - the pictures at te hotel website, lovely as they are, don't really do it justice.  The proprietors Diana and Dirk will organize your trip in advance, just tell them what you your interests are by email.  From here you can visit Lake Toba, Mt. Leuserk, go river rafting, walk to a nearby archeological site.  The atmosphere is wonderful - music wafting out of the open air lounge when a visiting pianist takes a turn at the great-sounding new Yamaha upright.  Beautiful main building and lovely quity comfortable CLEAN!!! rooms.
title: Lovely haven & perfect jumpring off place for Sumatra adventures

text: Heerlijk hotel in oase van rust buiten de drukte van Medan. Keurige en comfortabele cottages gelegen in schitterende tuin. Restaurant met heerlijke maaltijden en goed ontbijt. Zeer vriendelijk personeel. Top!
title: Heerlijk!

text:
Dans un cadre fabuleusement vintage, un accueil et un service vraiment très sympa.
Les chambres sont très belles, il y a une âme dans cet hôtel admirablement bien tenu par son propriétaire et sa femme qui s y donnent corps et âmes.
Coin de tranquillité et de ressource à Medan entre deux excursions.
L hôtel propose aussi des excursions sur plusieurs jours sur mesure.
Participe aussi à cette ambiance, les playlists musicales de "Plouplou L'Oriental" sur le site francais de streaming Deezer.
Le propriétaire commercialise également peut-etre le meilleur café au monde, l'Arabica de Sumatra. C"est au goût une véritable tuerie.
Le restaurant vous permettra sur ses terrasses de prendre du petits déjeuner au dîner, vos repas. J ai adoré les petits dej tôt le matin, avec le chant des oiseaux.
Un séjour vraiment des plus agréables.
title: Du bonheur dans la 3eme plus grande ville du pays. Un lieu dans, mais à l'écart de ville avec plein d arbres, des fleurs et un c

text: Voor de laatste dagen van onze vakantie zochten we een hotel waar we zouden kunnen ontspannen en dat is zeker gelukt bij hotel Deli River. Superschoon, prachtig onderhouden, ontzettend leuke meiden in de bediening, heerlijk zwembad. Fantastische keuken. Kortom niets te klagen. Als we dan toch iets te zeuren moeten hebben: we hadden een kraakbed en de stoelen bij het zwembad kon je niet in ligstand doen. Maar dit zijn echt punten waar we naar moeten zoeken. Tip: reserveer de massage. Dit is een soort social help programma (het hotel verdient niets aan de massage, je betaalt rechtstreeks aan deze mensen) De massage wordt gedaan door een blind echtpaar. Eerst denk je: wat dit moet worden maar dit is echt een hele stevige massage, in je eigen hotelkamer. Tijdens de massage denk je: is dit leuk maar na de massage voel je je echt als herboren! Aanrader!!
title: Heerlijk, ontspannen hotel!

text:
Onze reis naar Sumatra en Java, een reis die we in februari 2020 maakten, begon met een verblijf in hotel Deli River in Medan. Net als onze eerste reis die we maakten in 2012. Het was als thuiskomen in dit paradijsje in Medan. Ga je het terrein op dan laat je de drukte van de straat meteen achter je. Natuurlijk hoor je wel de oproepen van de moskeeën in de omgeving, maar die hoorden we in alle (zeven) hotels waar we gedurende deze uitgebreide reis overnacht hebben.
Veel waardering ook voor Restaurant De Ommelanden, behorend bij Hotel Deli River en reisbureau Tri Jaya. Vriendelijke en correcte bediening, heerlijk eten en een uiterst redelijke prijs. Veel respect hebben we voor de manier waarop het hotel en het restaurant plaatselijke krachten inzet en die een persoonlijke opleiding geeft, bijvoorbeeld in het Engels spreken.
title: Hotel Deli River, een heerlijke plek om terug te komen

text:
Wir sind 2 Nächte im Deli River abgestiegen, bevor wir eine Rundreise durch Sumatra starten.
Fazit: wunderschöne Anlage mit tropischem  Flair, erfrischender Pool, sehr gute Kommunikation im Vorfeld mit der Rezeption bezüglich Transport airport, spätes Dinner bei Ankunft. Das Essen war insgesamt sehr gut. Nettes Personal, sprechen recht gut Englisch, sehr guter Service.
Zimmer: hübsch eingerichtet, praktische Ablagemöglichkeiten, sehr sauber.
Das einzig Negative: wir wurden sehr häufig um 5 Uhr früh von den Muezzingesängen der 3 Moscheen in der Nachbarschaft geweckt》Oropax mitnehmen!
title: Sehr gutes Hotel zum Ankommen & Relaxen

text: Het was onze eerste nacht in Indonesië en meteen voelde je de sfeer van het land. De locatie aan de rand van een miljoenenstad, de architectuur en de uitstekende en vriendelijke bediening. Een goede start van onze Indonesië-tour (van Noord Sumatra tot aan Bali), georganiseerd en uitgestippeld naar onze wensen door het gelieerde Tri_Jaya Day Tours.
title: Hotel, Indonesisch in plaats van de standaard "Amerikaanse" stijl

owner_response.text:
Hartelijk dank voor uw commentaar over ons hotel. Het restaurant Omlandia van Hotel Deli River is gebouwd 
in een mix van locale Batak Simalungun arcitectuur gecombineerd met een koloniale bouwstijl wat vooral tot uiting komt in het veelvuldig gebruik van houten jaloezieen waardoor het geheel een sfeer van ‘tempe doeloe’ (sfeer van vroeger) ademt. Het restaurant is een open milieuvriendelijke constructie gebouwd op een hoogte naast de Deli rivier vallei waardoor er een  aangenaam bries je waait en dus minder warm. Hotel Deli River streeft naar een  eco vriendelijk concept met gebruik van zonne energie, herbruikbare waterflessen en zo weinig mogelijk plastic. We zijn blij dat u ons hotel zo waardeert. Na 
het verblijf in ons hotel heeft u een reis gemaakt met Tri Jaya Tour & Travel en we zijn blij  dat alles zo goed is verlopen. Management Hotel Deli River en Tri Jaya Tour & Travel.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We begonnen hier onze reis door Sumatra en Java. Alles was heel goed verzorgd. Erg gastvrij...prachtige omgeving en alles keurig netjes. Echt een prima startpunt voor onze nostalgia reis door Indonesië. Ik ben geboren in Soengei Gerong bij Palembang en wilde mijn geboorteplaats graag terugzien.
De reis was helemaal op maat gemaakt.
title: geweldig gezellig hotel en goede keuken

owner_response.text:
Hartelijk dank voor jullie beoordeling.

 We zijn blij dat jullie een aangenaam verblijf in Hotel Deli River hebben gehad. We doen ons best om een persoonlijke service te geven. In de keuken gebruiken we verse kruiden uit onze eigen tuin en alles wordt met zorg bereid. Onze cottages zijn verspreid in een tropische tuin, we proberen een eco vriendelijk beleid te voeren met zonne energie en zo weinig mogelijk plastic.

Heel fijn ook om te lezen dat jullie nostalgische reis op zoek naar de geboorteplaats Soengai Gerong zo goed is verlopen. Wij hebben talloze gasten gehad die op zoek zijn naar de plekken van hun persoonlijke verleden, zoals huizen waar ze in hebben gewoond, scholen waar ze op hebben gezeten, plantages waar de ouders of grootouders hebben gewerkt, en / of locaties van voormalige Japanse burger interneringskampen. Voor diegenen verzorgen wij speciale ‘nostalgie reizen’ op maat. We zijn blij dat jullie   reis zo’n succes is geweest.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Mit viel Liebe zum Detail und herzlicher Gastfreundschaft fühlen sich hier alle willkommen. 
Diana und Dirk mit ihrem Team tun alles um den Aufenthalt zu einem Genuss werden zu lassen: gute Küche, ein wunderschöner Garten, ein ansprechendes Swimmingpool und sehr grosszügige, gepflegte Zimmer mit guten Betten, alle mit eigener Terrasse.
Jeden Tag frische Blumen aus dem Garten im Zimmer! 
Wer die Ruhe sucht und doch nahe des Zentrums sein möchte, ist im Deli River gut aufgehoben.
title: Im Grünen entspannen

owner_response.text: Vielen dank fuer Inren kommentar. Es freut uns  dass Sie Ihren Aufenthalt in unser  Hotel apprezieren koennen. Wie sind ein eco freundlich Familien Hotel im Tropischen  Garten und vesrsuchen um optimalen service zu geben. Unsere mitarbeiter kommen alle aus dieses Dorf Namorambe und wir geben hier mit arbeit an die Menschen aus diesem Dorf. Wir sind gluecklich dass Sie solche gute Errinerungen an unser Hotel bewahren.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Loin du chaos ambiant du centre ville de Medan, l'hôtel River deli est un havre de calme et de verdure.
Notre chambre était simple mais confortable, la salle de bains récemment rénovée.
Le déjeuner était majoritairement fait maison, tout était excellent !
A recommander
title: Séjour au calme

text:
Hotel Deli River verwacht je niet zo midden deze drukke omgeving.
Het hotel ligt wel een eindje rijden vanaf het centrum en in de nabije omgeving is op loopafstand ook niet veel te doen. Wij hadden het als aankomst verblijf na onze vlucht vanaf Amsterdam. Omdat we al vroeg in de ochtend waren geland waren we om 07.00 al in het hotel. Hoewel het hotel zo goed als leeg was, konden we nog geen kamers krijgen en hielden ze vast aan de incheck tijd van 14.00
Uiteindelijk kregen we om 11.00 alsnog de sleutels.
Der kamers zijn goed en voorzien van alle nodige zaken zoals koelkast en airco.
Het ontbijt was goed, de eerste ochtend was het nog in buffetvorm en een ruime keuze. De 2e dag waren wij de enige 8 gasten en daarom moesten we van te voren aangeven wat we bij het ontbijt wilde hebben. Hierdoor iets minder keuze, maar begrijpelijk ivm met voedselverspilling.
Omdat er niet in de directe omgeving een restaurant zit, hebben we gebruik gemaakt van het bijbehorende restaurant Omlandia. De keuze is ruim voldoende, en smaakt ook goed.
We hebben de bitterballen niet geprobeerd. De eigenaar is van Nederlandse afkomst.
title: Relaxen buiten de stad

text:
Kamers zijn ruim, sfeervol en van alle gemakken voorzien. Gegroepeerd rondom een romantisch meertje. De tuin is een plaatje De opzet van het hotel is doordacht, origineel.
Erg vriendelijk personeel, uitgebreid ontbijt.
title: Een klein paradijs in hectisch Medan aan het begin en eind van onze reis door Sumatra

text:
Dit was onze eerste stop. Rustig gelegen. Mooie en schone kamers. Komisch dat ze bitterballen als snack hebben. Zwembad is klein maar fijn om af te koelen.
Personeel zeer vriendelijk. Omdat we voor 11.00 uur arriveerden betaalden we de helft van de kamerprijs extra.
title: Goede plek om te acclimatiseren

text: Heel fijne plek om te beginnen aan een rondreis en ook om terug te komen na een rondreis. Comfortabele kamers met alle voorzieningen incl. flesje anti mug. Onze kinderen hadden het er ook erg naar hun zin.
title: Fijne plek om te verblijven met vriendelijke medewerkers.

text:
Vi boede på hotel Deli River, en familie på to voksne og to små børn på deli river i to dage. Oktober er åbenbart lavsæson i Medan, så vi var stort set de eneste på hotellet. 
Stedet er som en lille oase, når man forlader vejen. Vi boede i et af værelserne med udsigt over søen i midten. Smukt sted. Maden var god og veltilberedt. Swimmingpoolen var helt fantastisk til børnene, da der var lavt vand i den ene ende. Og så sidst, men ikke mindst, så var personalet ekstremt søde og hjælpsomme. Vi kan kun anbefale andre, som søger stilhed og idyl at bo på hotellet. Mange hilsner Lærke, Jarl, Flora og Felix fra Roskilde, Danmark.
title: Lækker oase for afslapning

text: Kan geen negatieve dingen bedenken. Mooie grote kamers en netjes. Erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam personeel. Goed ontbijt en als het rustig was, bediening aan de tafel. Anders ontbijtbuffet. Mooie tuin en plekken om te relaxen
title: Perfect hotel en zo rustig

text:
Een sfeervol hotel met keurige schone kamers, gelegen rondom een vijver. Een prachtig zwembad. De service en bediening zijn werkelijk top, het eten is heerlijk. 
Een uitstekende plek om de vakantie op Sumatra te starten. 
Ik zou hier zeker terug komen.
title: Fantastisch, absolute aanrader.

text: Absoluut een lekker rustig plekje waar je niet de grote stad voelt (natuurlijk wel minaretten hoort). Fijn om hier bij te komen van de lange vlucht uit Nederland. Zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam personeel. Prima bedden.
title: Heerlijk plekje

text: Nadat we arriveerden in Indonesië zijn we gelijk doorgegaan naar het hotel. Daar werden we warm ontvangen door het personeel. Onze kamer was zeer schoon en leuk ingericht! We besloten aan het zwembad te gaan liggen waar we ook gelunched hebben. ‘S avonds hebben we ook nog in het restaurant gegeten. Het eten was erg goed! Al met al hebben we de overnachting als zeer positief en relaxed ervaren en zouden we dit hotel zeker aanbevelen.
title: Perfect

text:
Vriendelijk personeel en goede service.
De kamer is prima met airco. Een kleine tv en een redelijke badkamer. Bed is goed en eigenlijk niet veel op aan te merken dus.
Helaas ligt vlak naast het hotel een moskee.
5x per dag hoor je via de geluidsinstallatie de oproep voor het gebeld.
Kei en keihard. Ook al ben je een goede vaste slaper, hier ga je last van hebben.
Buitengewoon hinderlijk dus. Dat is het enige minpunt aan dit hotel. Het restaurant heet Omlandia en is goed. Nederland georiënteerd.
title: Lekker hotel

text: Hotel ist sehr gut gelegen, am Rande von Medan. Man bekommt nichts von den Lärm draußen mit. Einzig der Muezzin, der mehrmals täglich in voller Lautstärke zu hören ist. Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet, auch hier wird sehr viel Wert auf Nachhaltigkeit gelegt. Pool in schöner Lage, umgeben von einem grünen Garten. Essen am Abend sehr lecker, wobei die Preise schon sehr gehoben sind.
title: Nettes Hotel am Rande von Medan

text:
Der Transfer vom Hotel, ca. 30 km dauert etwa eine Sunde und kann durch das Hotel gebucht werden. Willkommensdrink bei der Ankunft. Am Samstagabend ist das Restaurant bis 22.00 h geöffnet, zum Glück, da wir erst spät ankommen.
Leckeres Abendessen im offenen Restaurant. 
Auch Weine im Glas werden angeboten. Indonesische Spezialitäten zum Frühstück.
Sehr schöne, grosszügige Zimmer und Dusche.
Wunderschöne Gartenanlage mit Pool und Weiher mit Seerosen. Viele liebenswürdige Details. Sehr hilfsbereites und freundliches Personal, das sehr gut englisch spricht. 
Schade hatten wir nur eine Nacht.
title: Ruhige Oase etwas ausserhalb der Stadt

text:
Na een lange reis vanuit nederland terechtkomen in een oase van rust. Mooi aangelegde tuin, ruime schone kamer met goed bed.
Wij zijn na jungle tocht hier nog 1 nacht teruggekomen en voelde gewoon als thuiskomen.
Lekker dobberen in heerlijk zwembad met een Bintang en bitterballen.....
title: Heerlijk uitrusten op rustige plek

text: De kamer was schoon en dat was wel lekker na wat meer primitievere omstandigheden elders. Ook lekker om een keer bitterballen te eten en spaghetti. Het ontbijt was magertjes en niet bijzonder. Ik zou er geen cappuccino bestellen want ze gebruiken er geen gewone melk en daardoor is de smaak ondefinieerbaar en zoet. Je hoort er diverse imams door hun megafoons tetteren en dat vonden wij minder prettig. Prima verblijf voor doorreis maar ik zou niet weten waarom ik hier langer dan een nacht zou willen verblijven.
title: Schoon maar lawaaiig

owner_response.text:
Geachte gast, dank voor het commentaar.
 
Het ontbijt dat u werd geserveerd bestond uit zelf gebakken geroosterd brood, zelf gemaakte ananas jam, zelf gemaakte pindakaas, papaya, ananas, gekookt ei, kaas, koffie, thee, verse papaya / ananas vruchtensap Verder  zelf gemaakte doughnuts, zelf gemaakte zoete broodjes met sesam zaadjes en broodjes gevuld met kokos. Tijdens het ontbijt hebben onze medewerksters Syaffitri en Lala 2 keer gevraagd of u nog nog meer wilde maar u zei dat alles naar wens was.
 
De cappuccino die u heeft gekregen was uit een sachet omdat de espresso koffie machine op dat moment even buiten gebruik was. Syaffriti heeft u verteld dat de echte espresso niet kon worden aangeboden maar dat u gratis cappuccino uit een sachet, inclusief suiker en melk, kon krijgen wat u accepteerde. Op dat moment was dit de enige optie. Het was dus niet de normale espresso koffie die wij serveren en u werd hierover tevoren geïnformeerd.
 
Betreffende moskee in de omgeving, u bevond zich in een land waar meer dan 90% van de bevolking moslem is en waar tijdens de vastenmaand, toen u er verbleef, meerdere keren per dag een oproep gedaan tot gebed. Dit geldt dus met name tijdens de vastenmaand, niet tijdens andere maanden. Noord Sumatra staat bekend om haar culturele, etnische en religieuze verscheidenheid waar Hindoe, Boedisten, Christenen en Islamieten vredig samenleven. Het gebied is een voorbeeld van tolerantie en wederzijds begrip. Wij hopen dat onze gasten hier eveneens begrip voor hebben.
 
Hotel Deli River is een kleinschalig familie hotel in een tropische tuin. Voor verder commentaar verwijzen wij graag naar andere reacties op Tripadvisor. Management Hotel Deli River.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Sehr ordentliches Hotel am Rande der Großstadt. Gebäude im niederländischen Kolonialstil. Professionelles Management der gesamten Anlage und Restaurant. Gute Essensauswahl am Abend sowie individuelles Frühstück am Morgen. Umliegende Moscheen sind in einem stadtnahen Hotel im muslimischen Land immer zu hören. Sehr empfehlenswert für einige Tage Städtetripp von Medan!
title: Stadtnahes und dennoch ruhiges Hotel

text: Hotel Deli River ligt paradijselijk op twee hellingen rond een weelderige tuin aan de rand van Medan. De kamers zijn ruim en bijzonder plezierig ingericht. Alle kamers zijn voorzien van airco, die heel slim is gemonteerd, waardoor je nergens in de "waai" zit of ligt. Mooi, ruim zwembad. Het personeel is buitengewoon vriendelijk en zeer behulpzaam. Het restaurant viel wat tegen. De kaart is beperkt en komt niet verder dan de meest gangbare gerechten, naast poffertjes, broodje kroket en bitterballen, dat dan weer wel. Kan eraan gelegen hebben dat we er waren in het laagseizoen.
title: Paradijselijk.

text:
Wir verbrachten 3 wunderbar erholsame Tage im Deli River Hotel. Es ist 2004 mit viel Liebe zum Detail im Kolonialstil von dem holländischen Eigentümer und seiner indonesischen Frau erbaut worden. Das Restaurant und der Frühstücksbereich sowie der wunderschöne Pool sind räumlich durch einen Teich von den Gebäuden mit den insgesamt 14 Hotel Zimmern getrennt. Die Zimmer sind individuell sehr geschmackvoll mit angenehmer Klimaanlage und warm Wasser Dusche ausgestattet.
Die Betreuung durch das Personal und die Eigentümer ist vorbildlich.
Das Frühstück und Essen im Restaurant ist sehr gut.
Das Hotel ist etwas außerhalb von Medan in einem schönen Umfeld gelegen. Man hat das Gefühl mitten im Regenwald zu wohnen. Für den Transfer zum Flughafen, der nur 50 min gedauert hat, hatten wir den Service des Hotels für 250.000 IDR gebucht.
Preis Leistungsverhältnis ist für alles aus unserer Sicht passend.
title: Eigentümer geführtes kleines exclusives Hotel

text:
Ett fantastiskt vackert ställe, kan inte fatta att det ligger så nära Medan. Man känner sig lite som i paradiset för det är otroligt vackert.
Rummen är fantastika och restaurangen likaså.
Helt enkelt ett toppenställe!!
title: Djungeltrip med en underbar paus .

text: Zeer aangenaam verblijf in een lodge achtinge omgeving in de suburb van Medan. Groots opgezet voor 14 kamers en suites. Met veel groen, bloemen, zwembad. Zowel een Europese/Ned als Indonesische keuken. Opgezet door een Ned Indonesisch echtpaar die met passie bezig zijn met hun gasten, hotel en hun personeel. Ze organiseren tevens trips en reizen met hun reisbureau Trijaja travel. Ideale lokatie om trips naar Bukit Lawang, Berastagi etc af te wisselen met de rust vh hotel. Specialiteit van de gastheer is de historie van Medan en Sumatra.Ik heb veel uit zijn boekje gehaald over koloniale tijden en ben via hem achter specifieke adressen van mijn vader gekomen die in Medan geboren is. Ze organiseren oa 4 historische tours. Nostalgia! Een aanrader ook buiten het toeristen seizoen.
title: Bijzonder idyllische plek in Medan Sumatra

text:
Wir waren für 2 Nächte im Deli River in einem Deluxe Cottage zu Gast. Wir wurden sehr herzlich empfangen. Das Check-in war unkompliziert und ein Begrüssunggetränk wurde ebenfalls angeboten. Die Mitarbeiter/innen sind alle sehr freundlich, zuvorkommend und machen fast alles möglich. Im Deli River wird darauf geachtet Plastik zu vermeiden. Im Zimmer gibt es nicht wie in anderen Hotels Plastik-Trinkflaschen, sondern eine Hart-Plastikflasche, welche täglich oder auf Verlangen aufgefüllt wird. Das Zimmer war für indonesische Verhältnisse sehr sauber, liebevoll eingerichtet mit Blumendeko aus dem eigenen Hausgarten. Die Gartenanlage wird täglich liebevoll gepflegt. 
Wir buchten eine Massage, welche im Zimmer stattfand und durch ein blindes Ehepaar durchgeführt wurde. Wir hatten schon in unzähligen Ländern Massagen und wir können sagen, dass diese Massage im Deli River zu den Top 3 gehört, welche wir je hatten!
Flughafen-Shuttle: Für 19 Euro für ca. 1 Stunde Fahrt vom oder zum Flughafen, bietet das Deli River einen Shuttle an. 
Das Morgenessen wird auf der Terrasse eingenommen. Es ist reichhaltig und schmackhaft, Kaffee, Saft, Eier, Pfannkuchen, Kokosgebäck, Toast, Käse, Butter, hausgemachte Konfitüre, etc. werden serviert.
In der Umgebung gibt es unzählige kleine einheimische Läden, 100m entfernt einen Alfamarkt mit ATM.
Wer eine kleine Oase mit Pool Und eigenem Restaurant (sehr zu empfehlen) ausserhalb Medan sucht, dann ist das Deli River das Richtige.
Vielen lieben Dank an das ganze Deli River Team für den angenehmen Aufenthalt.
title: Angenehmes, liebevoll gepflegtes Hotel ausserhalb Medan

text:
Meine Schwester und ich waren für 6Naechte im Deli River und wir genossen es in allen Bereichen.
Die Zimmer sind sauber und mit Liebe gestaltet,Blumen ,gute Betten mit sauberer Bettwäsche,ein Wasserkocher für Kaffee.Ein Ausblick der das Herz höher schlagen lässt auf ein Anwesen wie aus einer anderen Zeit.
Das Frühstück war abwechslungsreich und richtig ausreichend.Auch die Karte im Restaurant ist nie langweilig,selbst Vegetarier wie wir, hatten genug Auswahl.
Der Pool lädt zum Verweilen und Entspannen ein.Eine Auswahl an Büchern,eine Oase zum Seele baumeln lassen und hilfsbereites nettes Personal,lassen einen die Zeit vergessen.
Wir bedanken uns herzlich für den schönen Aufenthalt und wünschen euch alles Gute für die Zukunft.
title: Entspannen und Genießen

owner_response.text:
Dear Beatrix,

Thank you very much for staying in our hotel.
We are very pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay at our place so much.

We wish both of you all the best.

With warm regards from all of us in 

Hotel Deli River 🌺🌸🌺😊
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: De kamers liggen verspreid in een mooi aangelegd park met als middelpunt het restaurant. Het interieur van de kamers is ruim voorzien, de bedden zijn uitstekend evenals de santaire voorzieningen. Schoon en doelmatig. Uitstekende service.
title: Prachtig gelegen voorzieningen in een ruim opgezet park.

text: Schönes Hotel mit gutem Standard. Sauberkeit, Frühstück und Ausstattung passen. Leider etwas zu weit ausserhalb, deswegen ist man beinahe gezwungen im überteuerten Restaurant zu Essen. Das ist der einzige Minuspunkt.
title: Schönes Hotel

text:
Een rustige, groene uitvalsbasis vlakbij het drukke Medan.  
De Nederlandse eigenaren hebben een vriendelijke staf om zich heen verzameld. Ruime, schone kamer, prima bed en douche, en het is aangenaam zitten in het bijbehorende restaurant.
Maak gebruik van de informatie en het boekje van de eigenaar om de koloniale architectuur van Medan (beter) te leren kennen!
title: Heerlijk!

text:
Wir haben hier die erste Nacht vor unserer Rundreise verbracht und es war völlig ok! Die Zimmer sind ausreichend und sauber! Safe ist vorhanden! Der Pool ist schön aber zu warm!(Bakterien?)
Das Restaurant ist gut mit grosser Auswahl und sehr schmackhaft! Preislich etwas gehobener. Leider schließt das Restaurant um 21:00 Uhr, danach hat man keine Möglichkeit mehr etwas zu trinken zu kaufen!
Unser Fazit: für 1 bis 2 Nächte ok!
title: für 1-2 Nächte ok

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your stay in Hotel Deli River.

 Hygiene and security are our utmost priority. The temperature of our outdoor swimming pool depends on the amount of sunshine during the day. As we are in a tropical country the temperature of the pool is usually around 28 degrees Celcius. If there is more sunshine the chance on bacteria is lower. Our outdoor swimming pool is well maintained and we ensure that chlorine concentrations are correct and according to international hygiene and security standards, in order to ensure that there is no harmful bacteria in our swimming pool.
